loans.name: Juntos Para El Exito Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal “Juntos Para el Éxito” se encuentra ubicada en el distrito D. El Agustino, departamento D. Lima; está conformado por 10 socios entusiastas y emprendedores, están iniciando L. experiencia D. trabajar con  EDAPROSPO – prosperidad. Sus miembros realizan diversas actividades D. producción, comercio y servicio.
María natural D. Huancavelica quien es socio del grupo y a su vez asume el cargo D. presidenta, tiene 24 años, es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo D. 2 años D. edad, se dedica al comercio D. prendas D. vestir desD. hace 3 años; anteriormente realizo trabajos D. vendedora en una tienda, y fue así como se inicio debido a L. necesidad que había en su hogar, además se dedica a L. venta D. anticuchos por las noches (ayuda a su suegra), con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria María ha mejorado su vivienda y ha logrado comprar un televisor y un equipo D. sonido. Sus ingresos cubren los gastos D. alimentos y lo que le queda lo invierte en su negocio. El gran sueño D. María es tener un local granD. D. ropa. El reciente préstamo lo utilizará en L. compra D. mercadería para cubrir L. demanda D. sus clientes.  
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y están comprometidos a cumplir con los pagos según el cronograma otorgado por prosperidad. (En L. foto los niños son hijos D. los socios).
texts.en:
The communal collective “Juntos para el Éxito” (Together for Success) is located in the district of El Agustino in the Department of Lima. It is comprised of 10 enthusiastic and entrepreneurial members who are beginning to experience working with EDAPROSPO – Prosperity. Its members perform diverse activities of production, both of traD. and service. Maria is a member of the group and takes her turn to assume the office of president. She is 24 years old, lives with her partner and has a 2 year old son. She has worked in the garment traD. for 3 years. Earlier, she worked as a salesperson in a store. She started working due to the need that existed at home. She also works at night helping her mother-in-law selling “anticuchos” (small skewered pieces of grilled meat). Through her daily efforts Maria has improved her home and has managed to buy a television and a stereo. Her income covers the food bill and what remains is invested in her business. Maria’s great dream is to have a large, local clothing store. Her most recent loan was used to buy merchandise to meet the demand from her customers. All our member appreciate the support given them and are committed to making their payments on time. (The children in the photo are the members’ children.)

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise to meet demand

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba tiene 52 años, por lo que su actividad es la una librería y la venta de ropa. Por lo que tiene más de 32 años de dedicarse a este negocio, Alba siempre está buscando la manera de obtener ingresos para su familia. Esta no es la primera experiencia con financiamientos por lo que le han sido de ayuda necesaria para su negocio, además con ciertas ganancias logro comprar un poco de ropa para venderla a unos cuantos clientes. Sus 4 hijos trabajan de manera independiente y le ayudan en la atención con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cuadernos, lápices, borradores e invertir un poco en la compra de ropa. Su deseo es prosperar con sus 2 negocios.
texts.en:
Alba, 52, has a stationery store and also sells clothing. She has been in this line of work for over 32 years. Alba is always seeking ways to obtain income for her family. This isn't her first experience with financing; past loans have been of great help to her business. She used some of her profits to buy clothing to sell to a few customers. He four children work independently and help her with customer service. She will use the funds requested to buy notebooks, pencils and erasers as well as invest a bit in clothing. Her wish is to make progress with both of her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy notebooks, pencils, erasers and clothing.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 42 años, es separada, pero de aquel matrimonio tuvo cuatro hijos, de las cuales solo vive con los tres menores en su casa propia, de dos pisos, ubicado en un barrio al sur de Lima. Su labor principal es administrar su moto carro, vehículo que lo emplea su hermano de lunes a sábado, desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00pm de la noche, transportando pasajeros. En donde las ganancias que acumula del día, lo deriva para el trabajo de su hermano, pagándole S/ 20.00 soles, además que solventa su alimentación y con el resto de la ganancia, lo deriva en los gastos de mantenimiento que requiera el moto carro. Asimismo trabaja dos veces por semana,  limpiando casas ajenas, y de los ingresos adicionales, cubre los gastos de su hogar, sin descuidar la administración de su moto carro, ya que gracias a ello, puede ofrecer un mejor beneficio a sus hijos, siendo su mayor anhelo, que ellos  sean profesionales y hombres de bien. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, asimismo desea continuar asistiendo a su grupo solidario, por sentirse muy a gusto con ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa cambiar el motor de su moto carro y demás repuestos que necesita reemplazar.
texts.en:
Luz, 42, is separated but her marriage produced four children, of which only three still live with her in her own, two-story, house located in a neighborood in the southern part of Lima. Her main commercial activity is administering her mototaxi that her brother drives Monday through Saturday from 6am until 9pm providing passenger transportation services. From the daily profits, she pays her brother 20 soles daily and pays for his meals. The rest of the profits are used to pay for vehicle maintenance. In addition, she works two days a week as a cleaning lady in private homes and this additional income is used to cover her household expenses while not neglecting the care and maintenance of her mototaxi, since it is thanks to it, that she can offer her children a benefit since her greatest wish is that they become professionals and upstanding citizens. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. In addition, she hopes to continue to attend her group meetings because she feels very comfortable with them. She will use the funds requested to replace the engine in her vehicle and replace a few parts that need to be replaced.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new engine and spare parts for her vehicle.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 58 años, vive con su hijo Israel (26), en su casa que es  propia.Como la mayor parte del tiempo estaba solo busco una actividad a la cual pueda dedicarle todo su tiempo, pues su hijo trabaja y casi nunca estaba  en casa, es por esta razón  que optó por la venta de calzado. Esta actividad varía según las temporadas, en la actualidad se dedica a la comercialización de sandalias, y le genera buenas ganancias. Trabaja movilizándose en su triciclo por las  diferentes zonas del mercado de la zona por donde vive, a diario acomoda  de una manera vistosa  toda su mercadería, en el triciclo, ya lleva 5 años en este trabajo y le dedica prácticamente todo el día. Le gusta mucho las ventas  ya que puede interactuar con toda clase de personas y su carisma le ha permitido hacer  muy buenos amigos. En el futuro quiere instalar  un negocio fijo en algún mercado concurrido, pero por el momento se siente muy bien con este trabajo.Es el segundo crédito que tiene y esta muy agradecido con todos los que hicieron posible el préstamo que le permitirá continuar laborando.Manuel tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de mayor cantidad de  mercadería ,en calzado, ya que desea  mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuel, 58, lives with his son, Israel, 26, in his own house. Because his son works and is hardly ever at home, he was always alone. So, he needed to find something to do that would keep him occupied. He decided to sell shoes. This activity varies according to the season. Currently, he is selling sandals and is earning good profits. He travels on his three-wheeled vehicle to various markets near his home. He displays his wares in an eye-catching manner in his vehicle. He has been in this line of work for 5 years and spends almost the entire day at it. He enjoys sales very much because he can interact with all kinds of people and his charisma has made it possible for him to make many friendships. In the future, he would like to set up a fixed site in some busy market but, for the time being, he is content with his work as it is. This is his 2nd loan and he is very grateful to all the people that made his past loans possible so that he can continue working. Manuel plans to invest the requested funds in greater amounts of merchandise, shoes, because he wants to improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Maiela

texts.en:
Maiela and Beatriz, two sisters originally from Bolivia, are the hardworking owners of Susie’s Bridal Supplies. They have an unrelenting work ethic and unfailing determination to succeed. For Beatriz, a mother of two, much of her determination stems from a desire to provide for her children. “My life has not been easy, but I would like it to be easier for them. I don’t want them to have to work while they are in school, it is important that they are able to focus on their studies.”  

When the sisters first purchased the store from Susie six years ago, it was a party supply store with a generalized focus. However, they saw an opportunity to increase profits so Maiela and Beatriz made the timely decision to shift their focus to provide for more elegant events such as quinceañera parties, weddings, proms, and baptisms. They now spend many of their weekends with their four part-time employees, transforming event sites into glamourous spaces fit to hold that night’s celebration. “Every day and every party is a challenge. We’re excited to be doing this work, we love the adrenaline rush,” says Maiela. 

A $4,000 loan will help the sisters increase their inventory, better manage the operating costs of the store, and launch a more extensive marketing campaign. Although the economic downturn has made running a business particularly challenging, the sisters are optimistic about the future and confident in their business decisions. They work at the store every day, often until nine at night, and will do whatever is necessary to make sure their business is a success. 

As Maiela explains, “If you want to survive in this world, you have to be strong, you have to work hard. We work very, very hard.”

loans.use: Increase store inventory, help pay for store operating costs, increase advertising

loans.name: Ana Xiomara

texts.es: Esta cliente es originaria del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para mejorar su vivienda, compra de ladrillos, bolsas de cementos, para repellar su casa y ponerle piso, y asi vivir dignamente en su casa. Agradece mucho ya que le ha servido para que su familia tenga un techo y una buena casa donde vivir. Ha pagado en tiempo y forma sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This client is from the San Francisco del Norte municipality. The loan is to make improvements on her house. She will buy bricks, and bags of cement to plaster the house and put down the floor. That way she will live decently in her house. She is very grateful that the loan has served to give her family a roof over their heads and a good house. She has paid on time and as agreed upon.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bricks and cement

loans.name: Bertha Lidia

texts.es: Esta cliente es originario del municipio de San Francisco del Norte y el crédito será destinado para mejorar su negocio, bolsas de pan, cajas de shampoo, compra de enseres domésticos, tales como: aceite, arroz, frijoles, maíz, golosinas, cajas de jabón de baño, de lavar, ha sido una buena cliente, ha sacado su negocio adelante con la ayuda de créditos que ha obtenido y  cumple en tiempo y forma la cancelación de su crédito.
texts.en:
This client is from the San Francisco del Norte municipality. The loan is to improve her business. She will buy bags of bread, cases of shampoo, and domestic goods like oil, rice, beans, corn, sweets, cases of bathroom soap, and laundry soap. She has been a good client. She has gotten her business ahead with the help of the loans she has received. She has paid the loan completely and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy domestic goods

loans.name: Marlin Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Marlin Del Socorro, por lo que su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa usada. Por lo que siempre busca la manera de mejorar sus ingresos,  pues es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ella ha enfrentado ciertos problemas como es de salud, por lo que ha salido adelante con este negocio. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. El sueño, siempre ha sido tener una tienda grande en su casa, que pueda ofertar todos sus productos al público. Piensa algún día tener hijos y poder mantenerlos con el sudor de su frente, a través de las ganancias de su negocio.
texts.en:
Marlin Del Socorro buys and sells used clothes. She is always looking for a way to improve her earnings; it is her main source of income. She has encountered some problems like with her health, which is why she has moved forward in this business. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy raw materials. Her dream has always been to have a large store in her house where she could offer all of her products to the public. She plans to have children one day. She plans on being able to support them by the sweat on her brow via the earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly tiene 34 años, es casada, y de cuyo matrimonio tiene tres hijos, y juntos viven en la casa de su suegra. Se dedica en la venta de ropa, de manera ambulatoria, en un mercado populoso de su distrito. Desde entonces, tiene que luchar por un espacio dentro de este mercado, es así que va desde temprano, a las 5:00am de la mañana para que le puedan conceder el espacio, sin tener ninguna dificultad durante el día que trabaja. Al medio día retorna a su casa, para preparar el almuerzo de su esposo, que trabaja de albañil. Es así que lleva cinco años, realizando esta actividad, en la que ha sabido ganarse clientes, quienes hacen que su trabajo le sea rentable. Es por ello que en el futuro anhela adquirir un puesto dentro de ese mercado, de ese modo estabilizar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y confirma una vez más su compromiso de pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, además esta contenta de tener el apoyo de sus compañeras de su grupo, por ser muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más prendas de vestir, para brindar mayor variedad  de mercadería a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kelly, 34, is married and has three children; everyone lives in her mother-in-law's house. She sells clothes from place to place in a very busy market in her neighborhood. She has to fight for space inside the market so she gets there very early in the morning, at 5am, so that she can have a space assigned to her and not have any problems during her workday. She returns home at midday to prepare lunch for her husband, who is a bricklayer. She has been in this line of work for 5 years and she has managed to win over regular customers and improve her quality of life. This is her second loan with MFP and she once again pledges to repay in a timely fashion. Besides, she is happy to have the support of her fellow group members because they are very unified. She will use the requested funds to buy more items of clothing in order to offer her customers a greater variety of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 37 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su madre.Se dedica a la fabricación de muebles de madera con adornos en cuero, los cuales son exportados. Labora con una empresa que se dedica a este rubro y con la ayuda de 5 colaboradores, trabaja la madera y el cuero, así logran lindos muebles que posteriormente son enviados en las cantidades solicitadas a los diferentes lugares del mundo. A José le gusta mucho su trabajo y pone todo de su parte por sacarlo adelante, y eso se ve reflejado en la cantidad de pedidos que tiene, considera que la parte difícil radica en el esfuerzo que requiere el trabajar bajo presión, pues debe entregar los pedidos en los tiempos establecidos. En el futuro quiere comprar mayor cantidad de maquinaria para ampliar  su taller y elaborar los muebles  en menor tiempo.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene  y promete ser muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando.José tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mercadería en  madera y  cuero, que le hacen falta, para la elaboración de sus muebles.
texts.en:
José, age 37, lives by her mother’s side in his own house. He makes wood furniture with leather decorations, which are exported. He works with a company in this field and with the help of five other people. He works the wood and the leather. That way he makes lovely furniture, which is later sent in the requested quantities to different places in the world. José likes his work a lot, and he does everything he can to be successful. This can be reflected in the number of orders he has. The most difficult part stems from the effort that is required to work under pressure. He needs to deliver the orders on time. In the future he wants to buy more machinery to expand his shop and make more furniture in less time. This is his second loan, and he promises to be very punctual making his payments. Also, he is very grateful to all of the people who made this loan possible. It allows him to keep working. José plans to use the requested money to buy more wood and leather merchandise that he needs to make his furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood and leather to make furniture

loans.name: Adela Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Adela B. es originaria del caserío San Ramón del municipio de El Sauce. Su negocio consiste en la venta de cuajada y leche los cuales los elabora en su casa de habitación para luego venderlos en la terminal de buses, tiene ocho años de experiencia en este oficio. Trabaja con ceprodel desde hace dos años donde le han otorgado cuatro créditos para invertirlos en su negocio el que le  ha permitido mantener a su familia y salir adelante cada día.
texts.en:
Adela B. is from the San Ramón rural community in the El Sauce municipality. Her business is selling curd and milk. She makes them at home, and she later sells them at the bus terminal. She has been doing this for eight years. She has worked with Ceprodel for two years. She has had four loans, which she invested in her business. This has allowed her to support her family and to get ahead each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, rice, sugar, sweets, and milk

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: La señora Gloria Maria,  tiene 70 años de edad. La señora Gloria tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 50 años, ya que a su edad es muy difícil encontrar a un trabajo por lo que su edad no se lo permite. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de inventarios, principalmente desea invertir en compra de granos básicos, que son los que más busca la gente en su venta. Su sueño en el futuro siempre ha sido llegar a tener un mini súper.
texts.en:
Gloria Maria, 70, has a small grocery store in her home. She started this business 50 years ago because it's very hard to find employment at her age. She will use the funds to buy larger amounts of stock inventory, mainly basic grains, which are her best sellers. Her dream for the future is to have a mini-mart.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory for her store.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 38 años, convive con su pareja, de las cuales tiene dos hijos, y todos juntos viven en su casa propia. Por las mañanas trabaja cuidando niños, de la edad de 1 a 3 años, en un Wawa Wasi, desde las 7:00am de la mañana hasta las 4:00pm de la tarde, centro que queda a cinco cuadras de su casa. Ella se caracteriza por ser una persona tierna con todos los infantes, a todos los infantes que tiene que cuidar, y por el que ya ellos están acostumbrados a su carácter.  Por otro lado, Genoveva, aprovecha vendiendo ropa a los padres de estos infantes, dejando en la modalidad de crédito, siempre y cuando se quedan con el producto. De esa manera tiene ingresos adicionales, además vende casi toda la mercadería que tiene. Ella está contenta de cuidar niños y a la vez de vender ropa, una manera de tener doble ingresos para su hogar, es por ello que Víctor, su esposo, quien se dedica a transportar clientes en un triciclo en el interior del mercado, desea apoyarla en las compras, para que así no le falte mercadería que vender. En el futuro desea incrementar con una variedad de ropas exclusivas, siendo su mayor sueño tener un puesto en el mercado, y en donde pueda trabajar junto con su esposo. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, en donde reconfirma su compromiso en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, asimismo menciona que le tiene mucho aprecio a sus compañeras de su grupo solidario. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más prendas para niños, de esa manera tener satisfecha a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Genoveva, 38, lives with her life partner, with whom she has 2 children; they all live together in their own home. During the morning, from 7am to 4pm, she works caring for children between the ages of 1 and 3 in a Wawa Wasi (Quechua for Children’s Home-it’s a national child-care program for children under the age of 4), located five blocks from home. She is known for the tenderness with which she treats all the children under her care and they are all used to her way of being. On the other hand, Genoveva sells children’s clothing to these children’s parents; to insure that they keep the goods, she sells on credit. This is a way for her to earn extra income for her home; besides, she usually sells out all her merchandise. She is happy to care for children and sell clothing at the same time, a way to double her household’s income. This is why her husband, Victor, who transports passengers with his three-wheeled vehicle in the market, wants to support her with her purchases so that she won’t lack merchandise to sell. In the future, she would like to increase the variety of exclusive items, her greatest wish being to have a fixed site in the market so that she can work together with her husband. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she reconfirms her intention to repay in a timely fashion; she also mentions that she likes her fellow group members very much. She will use the funds to buy children’s clothes so that she can satisfy her customers’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's clothing.

loans.name: Nubia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Nubia G. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como maestra de primaria en la escuela de la comarca San José a unos 5 km de la parte urbana, tiene 25 años de impartir clases a los niños. Ha recibido tres créditos de ceprodel con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda y tener una vida digna. Su último crédito fue solicitado para gastos médicos para realizarse una serie de exámenes para mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Nubia G. is from the El Sauce municipality. She works as a primary school teacher at a school in the San José region, which is 5 kilometers from the urban area. She has been teaching children for 25 years. She has received three loans from Ceprodel. These were to improve her home and to have a decent life. She requested the last loan for medical expenses for a series of exams to improve her health.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Dionisio Anastasio

texts.es:
Dionicio Anastacio C. C., quien  Labora como INSTRUCTOR DE ELECTRONICA en el Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán Cecna, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y  estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, es su primer crédito con CEPRODEL durante este  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines, cemento, hierro y bloques para  la construcción de un cuarto en su casa de habitación .
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dionicio Anastacio C. C. works as an instructor of electronics at the Nicaraguan Center for Professional Training Alemán Cecna. He has two children under his care. They are school-age. He is married. This is his first loan with Ceprodel this year. During that time period he has invested the loan in making improvements to his home. He did this thanks to the loan from Ceprodel. The loan he is requesting is to buy construction materials like zinc, beams, cement, iron, and blocks to build a room in his house. All of this is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve and expand his home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es: José Alberto M. T. es un hombre trabajador que se preocupara por el bienestar de su familia, el adquirió una vivienda de interés social ya hace años y le ha hecho mejoras con ahorros propios para ofrecerles a sus hijos confort y un patrimonio seguro para cuando ello crezcan. Desde que adquirió la vivienda al techo no le ha puesto impermeabilizante y teme que en temporada de lluvia se pueda trasminar el agua, por este motivo el pide el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto y para esto necesita comprar material para su proyecto.
texts.en:
José Alberto M. T. is a hard-working man who worries about his family’s well-being. Years ago he got a house through social services. He used his own savings to make improvements in order to give his children comfort and a secure inheritance when they are grown. Since he got the house the roof has not been waterproofed. He is afraid that that it will leak during the rainy season. That is why he is asking for help to be able to complete his project. In order to do so he needs to buy material for his project.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproof his house

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor Manuel C. Gaitán, quien  Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado seis crédito con CEPRODEL durante un  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, piedra y hierro para la construcción de un baño en su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel C. Gaitán works as a hygienist at the Mercado Mayoreo in Managua. He is married and has four school-aged children under his care. He has had six loans through CEPRODEL in one year. During that time, thanks to the funding through CEPRODEL, he has invested his loans in making home improvements. This loan will be used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, and iron, in order to build an indoor bathroom. All of this is done with the the goal of providing improved security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and expansions

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa J. es madre de tres hijos a los cuales quiere darles una mejora calidad de vida; es por ello que todos los días por la mañana junto con su marido salen a trabajar en maquiladora. Teresa obtuvo una casa de interés social a la cual le ha ido haciendo mejoras ya que en un tiempo la dejo sola y los delincuentes se la destruyeron, con este crédito será su segundo préstamo en el que ha demostrado tener una cultura de pago muy buena y agradece el apoyo brindado para realizar su proyecto.
En este momento desea  terminar de instalar  el alambrado de su casa, ya que también los ladrones le robaron los cables y por lo que tiene que habitar en la casa de su hermana que le prestó mientras terminaba su casa.
texts.en:
Teresa J. has three children, and she wants to give them a better quality of life. That is why she and her husband go to work every morning in the factory. Teresa got a house from social services, and she has been making improvements. At one time she left it alone, and the delinquents destroyed it. This will be her second loan. She has demonstrated very good payment history, and she is grateful for the support in order to work on her project. At this time she wants to finish installing the wiring in her house. The thieves also stole the cables. Therefore, she has to live in her sister’s house, which her sister lent her while she finishes her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install wiring in her house

loans.name: Yairon Ezequiel

texts.es:
Yairon G. L., quien  Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo,  y  estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado ocho  crédito con CEPRODEL durante ocho  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de electricidad por lo que cambiara todo el sistema construcción como: zinc, perlines y clavos ya que el techo de su casa se encuentra e mal estado.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yairon G. L. works as a hygenist in the Mercado Mayoreo of Managua. He is raising four schoolaged children. He is married and has had 8 loans with CEPRODEL for the last 8 years. During that time he has invested the loans in the improvement of his housing, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL. The loan he is asking for is to purchase materials with which he going to change the whole construction system, such as: corrugated zinc, rods, and nails, since the roof is in poor condition. He is doing all of this to offer his children a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO IMPROVE AND ENLARGE HOUSING

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: En la comarca san miguelito municipio de somotillo el señor Mario Alberto M. H., se dedica a la producción agropecuaria dentro de las cuales destaca la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino, aviar y ovino también realiza el establecimiento de cultivos de subsistencia como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo los que le aseguran la alimentación de sus cuatro hijos y su esposa, dichas actividades las realiza según las estaciones de la zona ya que en su mayoría solo existen dos invierno que es donde establece sus cultivos y verano que asegura la alimentación para su ganado, dichas actividades son realizadas en la mayoría de las horas del día, se le han financiado siete créditos con los cuales ha aumentado su hato ganadero y mejorado su sistema de producción de uno menos tecnificado a uno mejor y mas productivo con este financiamiento pretende comprar tres vacas mas con las que espera aumentar la producción láctea y cárnica con las que espera mejorar la mantención de su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo, in the San Miguelito region, Mario Alberto M. H. works in agricultural production. Among his activities are raising cattle, pigs, poultry and sheep. He also farms subsistence crops, such as corn, sesame and sorghum, which allow him to provide a steady food supply for his wife and four children. He carries out these activities according to the seasons in his area, since usually there are only two: winter, when he establishes his crops, and summer, when he secures the food supply for his livestock. These activities take up most of the hours of his day. He has received financing for seven loans, which he has used to expand his livestock herds and improve his production system, from simpler methods to more technologically advanced ones. With the current loan, he plans to buy three more cows, so that he can increase his production of milk and meat and thus provide improved sustenance for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying three dairy cows

loans.name: Franklin Ariel

texts.es:
Franklin E. A., quien  Labora como Conductor A en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua UNAN-Managua, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y  estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado dos crédito con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: zinc, perlines y clavos para el techo de su casa de de habitación. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Franklin E. A. works as a driver for the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua (UNAN) in Managua. He is married and has two dependent children who are of school age. Franklin has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and during this period received two loans which were designated for making improvements to his home.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as zinc, crossbeams, and nails to repair the roof of his house. His goal is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to repair the roof of his house

loans.name: María Aurelia

texts.es: María Aurelia es una señora que ha demostrado que a pesar de la situación económica de cómo esta en este mundo ha sabido salir adelante con sus tres hijos. Ella desde hace tres años inicio un negocio de la venta de gorditas llamado “La Tonguis”, comenta la señora María Aurelia que empezó con dos kilos de harina y poco a poco fue creciendo el negocio en el que ahora es llamado por los clientes “Gorditas de la Quince” por que se encuentra en una calle de nuestra ciudad con ese nombre. La señora ha ido prosperando tanto que hasta construyo su vivienda y un lugar para usarlo de restaurante en el que quiere terminar de construir un baño para ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Aurelia is a woman who has demonstrated that she has known how to get her three children ahead in spite of the current world economic situation. Three years ago she started her business of selling “gorditas” (small, thick, corn flour tortillas). The business is called “La Tonguis”. María Aurelia says that she started with two kilos of flour. Her business was slowly growing, and now her customers call it “Gorditas de la Quince” because it is located on a street of that name in our city. She has been prospering so much that she even built her house and a place to use as a restaurant. She wants to finish building a bathroom there in order to provide her customers with better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building a bathroom

loans.name: Niño Fajardito Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Niño Fajardito inicia su cuarto ciclo con 12 socias.
Las socias son del departamento D. Huancavelica y realizan diferentes negocios.
Como es el caso D. Flor que es casada, tiene 3 hijos, Flor se dedica a la venta D. golosinas en la puerta D. su casa, para lo cual cuenta con una carreta, con sus ganancias pueD. mantener su hogar, con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara golosinas para incrementar su negocio.
Los sueños D. Flor son construir su casa y tener una tienda.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 200 soles, 300 soles, 500 soles, haciendo un total D. 4400 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The Niño Fajardito communal bank is beginning its fourth loan cycle with 12 members.

The members are from the department of Huancavelica and have different businesses.

In the case of Flor, she is married with 3 children. She sells sweets at the door to her house, for which she has a cart. With her earnings, she is able to maintain her home. With the loan requested, she will purchase more sweets to expand her business.

Flor’s dreams are to build her house and to have a store.

The members need different loan amounts such as 200 PEN, 300 PEN, 500 PEN, making a total of 4400 PEN in loans at the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sweets

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es:
Juana Margarita López Rodríguez, quien  Labora como Conserje en el Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería, ella tiene un hijo a su cargo,  y  este se encuentra en edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado cuatro crédito con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: zinc, perlines, clavos y mano de obra para el techo de su casa de de habitación. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana Margarita López Rodríguez works as a custodian at the National Engineering University (Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería). She is married and has school-age son. Juana Margarita has already had four loans with CEPRODEL within the last four years. During this time, she has invested the loans into making improvements in her home. She was able to do this thanks to the financing provided by CEPRODEL. The loan is she is requesting is for the purchase of construction materials such as zinc, roofing beams, and nails as well as to pay for the labor costs; these materials will be used for making improvements to the roof of her house. Juana Margarita wants to do all this in order to create a better and safer environment for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and expansion

loans.name: Luisa Isabel

texts.es:
La señora luisa C. se levanta de horas tempranas para elaborar los diferentes sabores de refresco para luego trasladarse a su puesto de venta en el mercado central finalizando a las 4:00 pm.

Este crédito que solicito es  para  incrementar su negocio en  la compra de más golosinas como: galletas, caramelos, meneítos, gaseosas, bolsas de agua,   y otros.
texts.en:
Luisa C. gets up early in the morning to start preparing different flavors of refreshments. Later, she goes to her vending post in the central market where she sells the refreshments until 4:00pm. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business. She would like to purchase more snacks such as cookies, candy, cheese puffs as wells as soft drinks, plastic bags of water, and other staples.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cookies, candy, soft drinks, different sweets, and plastic bags of water

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María de Jesús Córdoba R., quien  Labora como Conserje en el Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán CECNA, ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y  estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado diez crédito con CEPRODEL durante nueve años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: piso, cemento y mano de obra, para su casa de habitación. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María de Jesús Córdoba R. works as a janitor in the professional training center "Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán CECNA." She has 2 children in her care, and they are school-aged. She is married, and has taken 10 loans with CEPRODEL over the last 9 years. Over this period she has used the loans to invest in the house that she lives in. She was able to do this thanks to CEPRODEL. The loan requested will be used to cover construction costs: buying flooring, cement, and labor, to improve her home. She is doing all of this to provide better security and better living conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement: to buy construction materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Ángeles”, es natural de Urubamba, tiene 35 años, tiene dos hijos (Miguel Angel de 15 años y Maria Estefani de 13 años). Ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus menores hijos.

Honorata se dedica a la venta de verduras como por ejemplo lechuga, culandro, huacatay y perejil, ella nos cuenta que no  tiene una chacra propia pero tiene que alquilar una chacra para sembrar sus productos, ella después de cosechar sus productos manda y vende a las vendedoras del mercado de Huancaro. Ya son 7 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo  La socia nos cuenta que tiene clientes fijos que le hacen pedido de las verduras, pues sus productos son de calidad y sus clientes se encuentran contentos. El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesionales a sus hijos.  

Honorata requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas como por ejemplo lechuga, perejil y huacatay, ella también va comprar abono para la chacra.     

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Honorata is a member of the “Reyna de los Ángeles” (Queen of Angels) communal bank. She’s from Urubamba, 35-years-old, and has two children (Miguel Angel, 15, and Maria Estefani, 13). She is a responsible mother who seeks every opportunity to get ahead with her daily effort and provide a better future for her children. Honorata is a vegetable merchant. She sells such items as: lettuce, coriander, huacatay (native Peruvian herb related to marigold and tarragon) and parsley. She tells us that she does not own her own fields so she must lease land to grow her products. Once she harvests, she sends it to market vendors in Huancaro’s market to sell. She has been in this line of work for 7 years now and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She tells us that she has regular customers that order her vegetables because her products are of good quality and her customers are satisfied. Her dream is to see her children become professionals. Honorata needs funds to buy seed like: lettuce, parsley and huacatay; she also will buy manure for her fields. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed.

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es:
José Nicola H. C., quien  Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Israel Lewites de Managua, el tiene tres hijos a su cargo,  y  estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado nueve crédito con CEPRODEL durante nueve  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por  CEPRDEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de  construcción como: zinc y pintura para una parte del techo de su casa ya que el que tiene se encuentra en mal estado. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Nicola H. C. works as a dental hygienist in the Israel Lewites de Managua market. He is married and has three school-aged children in his care. He has received nine loans with Kiva partner Ceprodel over the past nine years. Thanks to Ceprodel he has been able to use this money to improve his home. The funds from this loan will be used to buy construction materials such as zinc roofing and paint for part of the roof of his house which is in poor condition. His goal is to provide his children with better security and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve his house

loans.name: Karla Martina

texts.es:
La señora karla barca venda ropa usada en el mercado la estación de León dando inicio a sus ventas  a las 7:00 Am donde recibe a su clientela para ofertar su mercadería siendo su mayor clientela la gente de las comarcas
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de pacas de ropa usada y calzados.
texts.en:
Karla Barca sells used clothing in León's La Estación market; at 7am she opens for business and starts receiving her customers and offering them her merchandise. The majority of her customers are from the surrounding region. She will use this loan to buy bales of used clothing and shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy used clothing such as: shorts, t-shirts, pants, skirts, children's clothing, blouses, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es:
Silvio Antonio S., quien  Labora como Colector de Ruta en el Mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua, el tiene cinco hijos a su cargo,  y de estos cuatro se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado siete crédito con CEPRODEL durante nueve  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en el sistema eléctrico de su casa de habitación.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvio Antonio S. works as a custodian in Managua's Roberto Huembes market. He is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. He has had seven loans with Kiva partner Ceprodel over the past nine years and has used the money to improve his house. This loan will be used to put an electricity system in his house. Silvio's goal is to provide his children with better security and improved living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve his house

loans.name: Proyeccion Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyección inicia su ciclo 16 con  14 socias.
Las socias son del departamento D. Huancavelica y realizan diferentes negocios.
Como es el caso D. Nemesia que es casada y tiene 7 hijos, Nemesia se dedica a el traslado D. carga en diferentes instituciones, actividad que realiza con su esposo. Además Nemesia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, negocio que fue implementando poco a poco para ayudar en los gastos del hogar. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. tubérculos para surtir su tienda. Nemesia sueña con mejorar su negocio.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 400 soles, 500 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 8900 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Proyección" started its 16th loan cycle with 14 members. The members are from the Huancavelica region and they have a variety of businesses. As is the case for Nemesia, who is married and has 7 children. Nemesia has a business transporting cargo to different institutions, an activity that she carries out with her husband. In addition, Nemesia has a store in her home where she sells groceries. She established this business gradually in order to help with the household expenses. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of root vegetables to stock her store. Nemesia dreams of improving her business. The members need loans of various amounts such as 300, 400, 500 or 1,000 Peruvian soles, making a total of 8,900 soles of loans for the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy root vegetables

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, la señora María Martínez se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y por preocuparse por el bienestar de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo ha requerido la inversión para reconstruirla. Ella actualmente está solicitndo un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo esta obra y así beneficiar directamente a toda su familia con un techo digno donde habitar.

Ella se siente muy satisfecha porque saldrá adelante con dicho crédito y mejorará sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Elsa Martínez Meléndez works as a file clerk in the Oriental market in Managua. She has one child in her care, who is school-aged. She is married, and has taken 5 loans with CEPRODEL over the last 9 years. Over this time she has invested the loans in improvements to her house. She was able to do this thanks to the financings provided by CEPRODEL. The loan requested will be used to buy construction materials such as: sand, cement and steel to reinforce the walls of her house. She wants to do this to provide better security and a better quality of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construcción

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Ángeles”, es natural de Urubamba, tiene 48 años, tiene una hija llamada Rocio de 11 años. Ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a su hija.

Delfina se dedica a la venta de bebidas alcohólicas como por ejemplo cerveza y chicha (La chicha de jora es una bebida ancestral en el Perú y América, y su principal ingrediente es la jora o maíz fermentado.), ella prepara chicha solo los días miércoles, viernes y domingos para vender en su picantería. Ella también se dedica a la agricultura y siembra maíz y zapallo. Ella nos cuenta con mucha tristeza que por causa de las fuertes precipitaciones que cayeron en la ciudad de Urubamba, el maíz se malogro y dejó perdidas irrecuperables, pero a pesar de las adversidades la socia seguirá trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia. Las socia requiere el préstamo para comprar abono, semilla y jora.   El anhelo de la socia es abrir una tienda donde pueda vender frazadas y colchones.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Delfina belongs to the Reyna de los Ángeles Communal Bank. She is a native of Urubamba. She is 48 years old, and she has an 11 year old daughter named Rocio. She is a responsible mother who is every minute looking for opportunities to get ahead. Through her daily effort she looks to give her daughter a better future. Delfina sells alcoholic beverages such as beer and “chicha” (“chicha de jora” is an ancestral drink in Perú and América. The main ingredient is yellow or fermented corn). She only makes chicha on Thursdays, Fridays, and Sundays to sell in her restaurant. She also farms and grows corn and zucchini. She tells us very sadly that due to the strong rains that fell in the city of Urubamba the corn was lost, and she was left with unrecoverable losses. But, in spite of the adversities, she continues working to get her family ahead. She needs the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and yellow corn. She wishes to open a store where she could sell blankets and mattresses. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seeds, and yellow corn

loans.name: Reynaldo Del Carmen

texts.es:
El  Sr. A. trabaja en la Alcaldía de Puerto Morazán-Tonalá,  que está ubicada en el municipio del Viejo, departamento de Chinandega.

El va a utilizar el crédito para reparar el techo de su vivienda  ya que se aproxima el invierno y no quiere estar desprotegido contra el agua.

Este es el quinto  crédito que tiene con la Institución los cuales  siempre los han pagado bien  y dice estar muy agradecido  por ayudarla y brindarle apoyo cuando el lo  necesita.
texts.en:
Señor A. works in the municipality of Puerto Morazan-Tonala, which is located in the town of Viejo, Chinandega. He will use this loan to repair the roof of his home, since winter is coming and he does not want to be unprotected from the water. This is the 5th loan that he has taken from the institution. He has always made his payments well, and he says that he is very grateful for the help and support that has been provided when he needed it.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase products for her hamburger stand

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey F. is from the village of Salawagan, Quezon Bukidnon. He is 22 years old. Rey is single. To make a living, Rey owns & operates a service-based business providing transport services to local community members. Rey has been a "habal-habal" driver for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Rey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rey is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rey from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide transport service.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Téllez P.  es una profesora que trabaja en la Esc. Santa María de la Merced que está ubicada en el municipio del Viejo, departamento de Chinandega.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito para reparar su vivienda ya que tiene malo el zinc de su casa y lo quiere cambiar.

Este es cuarto   crédito que tiene con la Institución y todos los ha pagado muy bien y espera siempre seguir trabajando con Ceprodel por tal razón dice estar muy agradecida por ayudarla y brindarle apoyo cuando ella necesita.
texts.en:
Señora Téllez P. is a teacher who works in the Santa María de la Merced school, which is located in the municipality of Viejo in the Chinandega department. She will use this loan to repair her home; the metal roofing of her home is in bad shape and she wants to replace it. This is the 4th loan that she has taken from this institution, and she has made her payments very well. She hopes to continue to work with CEPRODEL, and says that she is very grateful for the help and support that was provided when she needed it.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement - to repair her roof

loans.name: Roquela

texts.en:
Roquela N. is from the village of Palacapao, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Roquela is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Roquela owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Roquela has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

texts.es:
El  Sr. José Enrique P. trabaja en la Alcaldía de Puerto Morazán Tonalá que está ubicada en el municipio del Viejo, departamento de Chinandega.

El  va a utilizar el crédito para reparar su vivienda ya que necesita reparación en el techo de su casa.


Este es el cuarto  crédito que tiene con la Institución y todos los anteriores  siempre los han pagado  bien,  y a la vez dice estar muy agradecido con Ceprodel por la  ayuda que siempre le han brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. José Enrique P. works for the town of Puerto Morazán Tonalá, which is located in the Viejo municipality, Chinandega department. He will use this loan to repair his dwelling. The roof of his house needs work. This is his fourth loan with our institution, and he has a good credit history. He says he is very grateful to CEPRODEL (local lending institution) for the help it has always given to him.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Dorjpalam

texts.en: Dorjpalam is 45 years-old and lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house which they built themselves. During the day, he operates a consumer goods trading business in his town.  He has been operating his business since 2004, and has steadily expanded it. In 2004, his working capital was 1,000,000 tugrugs (~ 705 USD), and with his business profits Dorjpalam built a house for his family .  His wife, Bulgantamir, sells goods at the Terh trading center. With the experience they gained in previous years, they are knowledgeable about their product prices and selection, and have a loyal customer base. Dorjpalam is a very hardworking person. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1407 USD) loan to purchase more inventory for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Om

She is engaged in a business as a recycler and fabric producer, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a farmer growing rice and corn, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Their standard of living has improved since P. and her husband have had these businesses. P. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more recyclable materials, and corn and rice seeds to expand the farming output. This is her first loan from Kiva partner CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more recyclable materials and seeds.

texts.en: Batchuluun is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 8 and 7, in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent. Currently, she operates a cement business with her husband in her home province. They rent a workplace for their business and they have two employees. Previously, she operated a raw materials trading business between 2005-2007, and before that, she operated a grocery store for five years. Batchuluun has gained great business experience in previous years and she has  good communication skills. She says, “I am working hard with my husband for my two sons' futures.” She is requesting a 3,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase more cement for her business.

loans.use: To purchase cement

texts.en: Ob C., aged 39, is married and resides with her five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of groceries in her village, earning a gross income of USD 15 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a construction worker in the city, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Ob C. and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Suy L. E., aged 54, is married and resides with her child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business as a recycler, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a bike repairman, earning an income of USD 8 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Suy L. E. and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to transport recyclable materials to sell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Jocelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn B. is from the village of Bucot, Pangasinan. She is 41 years old. Jocelyn is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jocelyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising pigs for fattening and sale. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $157 a month from these activities.

In 2006, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen C., aged 24, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of selling groceries at home, earning an income of USD 9 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 8 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Pen C. and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase more groceries to stock her store and to expand her current business before the Cambodian New Year arrives. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house which they built themselves. He operates a raw materials trading business in their town with his wife. He sells a variety of animal products to his many customers. Ganzorig started his business in 2000 with a working capital of 150,000 tugrugs (~ 105 USD). After 10 years of successful operations he has managed to increase his working capital to more than 2,920,000 tugrugs (~ 2055 USD). His earnings have enabled him to build a larger house for his family.

Ganzorig is a very hard working person and says, “It was hard for me to find a job related to my profession. However, I started my own business and am providing money for my family's expenses.” He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1407 USD) loan to purchase more raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his animal products trading business

loans.name: Thou

texts.en: Thou S. is married and resides with her six children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of selling firewood, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice and beans, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Thou S. and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of USD 375 to purchase a machine to grind rice. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a machine to grind rice

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita G. is from the village of Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 58 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 11000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen M., aged 45, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business selling palm sugar, earning an income of USD 3.5 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a skillful blacksmith, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Sen M. and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase more palm sugar and vegetables for resale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner. (Sen M. is pictured with her daughter.)

loans.use: To buy palm sugar and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen S., aged 42, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She stays at home as a housewife to look after her children and do the household chores. Her husband is a soldier for his province, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family's expenses and the children’s education. Chen S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a plot of farmland to start a business as a farmer to generate another source of income for the family. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Terbish

texts.en:
Terbish is 34 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger. They have been living together in their current home for 20 years. Terbish operates a mobile dairy trading business in her town. She sells a variety of dairy products such as curds, milk and other products.

Terbish started her business in 2005 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~ 352 USD). After years of successful operations she has managed to increase her working capital to a level exceeding 3,000,000 tugrugs (~ 2111 USD) today. Her earnings have enabled her to buy a car which has proven useful in transporting her products and expanding her customer base. She is a very hardworking and open-minded person. Terbish is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~ 2111 USD) loan to increase her business's working capital.

loans.use: To increase her business's working capital

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S., aged 37, is married and resides with her six children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business producing Cambodian noodles at home, earning gross income of USD 15 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a teacher, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Keo S. and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase a stock of rice from which to produce the noodles. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy rice to produce Cambodian noodles

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian G. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old, married and has six adult children. To make a living, Vivian owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as cosmetics, lotions, etc. in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 30000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Vivian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Khiev K., aged 47, is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She stays at home as a housewife to look after the children and do the household chores while her husband sells palm sugar, earning an income of USD 8 per day. He climbs the palm trees in his village every day during the season to collect as much palm juice as possible. Their standard of living has improved since her husband has had this business. Khiev K. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner. (Khiev K. is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya is 47 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in an apartment. Her daughter, Nyuamsuren, is 20 years old and currently attends university. They have been living together in their current home for 17 years. Tuya operates a meat trading business at a local trading center in her town. She sells a variety of meat to her many customers at a counter which she rents.

Tuya started her business in 2001 with working capital of 50,000 tugrugs (~ 35 USD). After years of hard work and determination, her business capital now exceeds 1,000,000 tugrugs (~ 705 USD). She has a loyal customer base and attributes her growing success to her good communication skills and experience as a businesswoman. Tuya is very hopeful for the future and says, “I would like to purchase a car with my business profit.” She is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (~ 562 USD) loan to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en: Sugran is a wife of M. I. lives in a city named Borewala a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan. She is a vigorous lady. She makes embroidery on the simple clothes for her husband’s cloth shop. She does this work to attract more customers in his shop because people admire handmade embroider without thinking about its cost. These clothes give them good income. Her husband feels great when she helps her in his cloth selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy material (clothes and colored thread and sketches) to expand her husband’s cloth selling business.

loans.use: To buy material for cloth selling business.

loans.name: Nann

texts.en: Mr. Nann N., 37, sells chop-wood that he carves from the forest or buys from people who live near the forest. He has been operating in this sector since 2000 and makes around $3 per day. His wife, Mrs. Lux Gnek, 37, is a mother who farms in two seasons, both rainy and dry, earning approximately $2 each day. This couple lives with their three children in Sort Nikom commune, in the province of Siem Reap. Nann N. will be using the loan to hire a laborer to repair his old house.

loans.use: To repair his old house.

loans.name: Zolboohuu

texts.en:
Zolboohuu is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His wife, Dulmaa, operates a seasonal construction business and his daughter and two sons all attend a local secondary school. They have been living in their current home for the past 23 years.

Zolboohuu operates a transportation business in his local area. He transports people throughout his province and has a loyal customer base who appreciate his convenient service. Zolboohuu started his business in 2008 with capital of 700,000 tugrugs (~ 495 USD) and after years of successful operation has increased his working capital to a level exceeding 1,500,000 tugrugs (~ 1,055 USD) today. His earnings have enabled him to renovate his car and improve his service. Zolboohuu is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~ 351 USD) loan for his transportation business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang D., aged 44, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business selling motorbike spare parts at a local market in the province, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a motorbike repairman, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Seang D. and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more motorbike spare parts to stock the store. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts for resale

loans.name: Tahira Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Tahira yasmeen is a wife of M. R. lives in a city named Borewala, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan. 

She is a very talented lady. She prepares embroider clothes on order and earns income. Her income allows her to provide the good standard of living to her family. Her husband is a plumber and also sells the sanitary supplies in the community. He generates approximately Pak Rs. 15,000 on every month. They both utilize their income to pay for the utilities and to manage the financial expenses. She is applying for a loan to buy sanitary supplies (taps, water pipes) to expand her husband’s business.

She has three other ladies in her loan group. Ruqaiya begum wants a loan to buy electric supplies such as (wires, switches and tube lights) for her electric shop. Bilquis wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her cosmetics selling business. Mussarat wants a loan to buy books such as (syllabus, religious) for her book shop.

loans.use: To buy sanitary supplies to sell

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor M., aged 30, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business providing public phone services and selling cosmetic products, earning an income of USD 1.9 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband is a teacher, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Sor M. and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more cosmetic products to sell. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner. (Sor M.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen L., aged 36, is widowed and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business selling cosmetic products, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the famiL.'s expenses. Their standard of living has improved since Sen L. has had this business. She is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more cosmetic products for resale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Pruon

texts.en: Mrs. Pruon L. is 37 years old and raises pigs and vegetables from which she earns a living. Her husband, Mr. Reiy Norb, is a 33-year-old local fisherman. They live together in a commune of Siem Reap Province. With her businesses, Pruon L. typically earns around $2 a day, while her husband usually earns around $3 a day. They have two young kids at home. In order to expand her business and increase their income, Pruon L. needs a loan of $200 to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S., aged 53, is widowed and resides with her six children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia.
