She is engaged in a business sewing and designing clothes, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family's expenses. The family is also assisted by four of the children who are currently employed at different workplaces. Their standard of living has improved since Keo S. and her children have had these businesses.

Keo S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase supplies and equipment as a chef for ceremonial occasions. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner. (Keo S. is pictured with her daughter and her grandchild.)

loans.use: To buy kitchen supplies to start a new business as a chef

loans.name: Phoak

texts.en: Phoak T., aged 45, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business producing hand-made products from bamboo, earning an income of USD 1.5 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband works in a factory producing bricks, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Phoak T. and her husband have had these businesses. She is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a motor to operate a fishing boat during the rainy season that is coming soon. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motor to operate a fishing boat

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a wife of M. A. and a citizen of a city named Borewala, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan.

Her husband runs a sweetmeat shop in the market. His shop is the busiest one. People use to come to him for ordering the sweetmeat because of his good quality items. Azra has a skill of making artificial flowers. People use these to decorate their houses. Her art gives her approximately Pak Rs. 8,000 per month which helps her to pay for the utilities. 

They both never waste any minute because they know the value of time. Azra uses her income to pay for the utilities but she takes out some money from her income for rainy days. She is applying for a loan to buy items (sugar, cooking oil, dry fruits) for her husband’s sweetmeat shop.

She has two other ladies in her loan group. Jannat Firdous wants a loan to buy items (chairs, mirror and scissors) for her barber shop.
Yasmeen wants a loan to buy chickens for her chicken meat selling business.

loans.use: To buy material for sweetmeat business

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Om S., age 46, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She stays at home as a housewife to look after the children and the household chores. Her husband is a construction middleman, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Their standard of living has improved since her husband has had this business. S. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase more construction supplies to expand her husband business.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to expand the business

loans.name: Duk

texts.en: Duk M., a 50-year-old  married mother of four, resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia.  Duk is engaged in the business of selling bread-filled ice cream, earning an income of $6 per day to help cover the family expenses, while her husband is a recycler, earning an income of $9 per day. Their standard of living has mproved since starting these businesses, and Duk is now requesting a loan of $200 to purchase more recyclable materials for sale. This will her sixth loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy recyclable materials for sale

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea L., age 31, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of groceries, earning a gross income of $30 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a goldsmith, earning an income of $2.50 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since L. and her husband have had these businesses. L. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Fozia Bakarkham Group

texts.en:
Bebe Afiza is a member of the Fozia Bakarkham group. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married with five children who are all school students.
She operates a quilt sewing business and is a talented woman. She can make different kinds of quilts and special quilts for Afghan brides. 

She would like to receive the loan for expanding her business and purchasing cloth and fabric. She hopes to grow her business and to give her children a better education.

loans.use: Buy necessary materials for her business

loans.name: So

texts.en: So S., age 45, is married and resides with his wife in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. He has no children. He is employed as a  police officer in his province, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. His wife is employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of $2.60 per day. Their standard of living has improved since S. and his wife have had these jobs. S. is requesting a loan of $700 to repair the house. This is his third loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Hoeurng

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeurng M., 29, has a small business whose main operation is to buy and sell mature rice in the village. Also, M. buys rice in bulk at reasonable prices from farmers, sends the rice through a milling machine and then sells it for a profit.  By doing this, she has the ability to generate $6 to $7 a day to help improve the financial problems of her family. M. has a life partner in her husband who owns a machine to provide a milling service. The family has three school-aged kids who depend on their income. The price of rice is low at this time. M. hopes to acquire more rice for her stock by using a Kiva loan. She will mill the rice and sell it to earn extra income.

loans.use: To buy more rice.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta S. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old. Marietta is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Marietta runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marietta has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Marietta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marietta is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem S., age 30, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business of selling vegetables at a local market in the town, earning an income of $2.80 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband operates his motorbike as a driver, earning an income of $8 per day. Their standard of living has improved since S. and her husband have had these businesses. S. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband because the old motorbike is old and consumes more gasoline. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Seoung

texts.en: Seoung S., age 24, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is employed at a local garment factory in the province, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband operates his motorbike as a driver, earning an income of $6 per day. Their standard of living has improved since S. and her husband have had these jobs. S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike because the old motorbike needs frequent repairs. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Chhoeng

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoeng Y. is 50 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She has eight children. The first three are married and live separately, and the other five are single. To help feed the family, two of her children have ready attained suitable occupations. Y. is married to Ty, 41, who is a chop-wood (firewood) seller with a net income of $3 a day. Since 1998, Y. has earned a living by raising pigs in her pig pen behind her house. Her business is going well and she needs to buy more pigs to raise, so that is why she requested a loan of 1,200,000 KHR from Kiva’s project partner, HKL. She is hopeful this will bring her additional income.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to sell.

loans.name: Nasrin Khalid Group

texts.en: Khalid is the group leader of the Nasrin Khalid group. He lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with four children and all the family members benefit from the income he generates. He has a general store where he sells a variety of items. He needs the loan to purchase items which are not yet available in his shop. He wants to attract more clients and expand his business. He hopes to be one of the best businessmen in the future.

loans.use: To expand the variety of items he sells.

loans.name: Namoz

texts.ru: Нуралиев Намоз проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Работает сантехником. Кроме того занимается растениеводством. Берет в аренду земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. В этой области уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян. Он хочет посеить и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Namoz N. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 50 years old. He is married and has four children. He has secondary education and works as a plumber. Besides that he does agriculture. He rents a plot of land where he grows vegetables. He has been in this business for ten years. The loan will be used to buy seeds. He wants to sow and collect a good harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Hean

texts.en: Mrs. V. is 23 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is the mother of four children who are students at the secondary school. She is married to Nara, who is 30 years old and a machinery repairman. To earn her daily revenue, V. goes to buy chickens in bulk at low prices from the rural people and then sells the chickens at retail prices at the market for a profit, earning about $6 a day. Recently V. received orders from her customers for a hundred kg of chickens, but she lacks the cash to buy enough chickens to fill her customers' requests. Therefore, V. is applying for a loan of $300 to serve as capital so that she can buy more chickens for her clients. V.'s husband appears at the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa D. Jesús C. D. G. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 12 y 16 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Teresa posee una venta D. tortillas, la cual está ubicada en su casa D. habitación, en este lugar día con día Teresa se dedica a elaborar las tortillas, las cuales están hechas únicamente D. maíz, y las comercializa al mediodía en las tardes. Este negocio es muy rentable, ya que se venD. todos los días, y por ser una amable, posee muchos clientes que a diario llegan  a su negocio. Así mismo Teresa posee un molino, el cual no solo lo utiliza para moler su maíz, sino también  lo alquila a otras personas que habitan en los alrededores D. su casa. Teresa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz, así mismo comprar algunos repuestos para el molino, con el fin D. mejorar la calidad D. su servicio. Ella es una persona la cual se esfuerza en gran manera por obtener más ganancias, ya que cuenta con el enorme deseo D. poder brindarle una vida mejor a su familia y brindarle ese apoyo tan necesario a su esposo.
texts.en:
Teresa D. Jesús C. D. G. is 35 years old and resides in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her husband and two children (ages 12 and 16) who are in school. Teresa prepares and sells corn tortillas day after day from her home. Her sales begin at 12pm. Her business is very profitable because she sells every day. Due to her friendliness, she has many customers who come by her business on a daily basis. Teresa also owns a grain mill. Not only does she use it to grind her corn, but she also rents it out to other people who live in the area surrounding her home.

Teresa is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of corn. At the same time, she will purchase a few spare parts for her grain mill so that she can improve the quality of her service. She is a person who greatly strives to earn more income, which will proviD. a better life for her family and enable her to contribute needed support to her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn & spare parts for her grain mill

loans.name: Ingrid Yucira

texts.es: Ingrid Yucira M. P. de 30 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután,  vive junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar para una empresa privada y tres hijos de 13, 11y 9 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ingrid posee una venta de cosméticos, ganchos, colas de macho, diademas, quita esmaltes y otros productos más. Su negocio esta ubicado en la calle principal de Usulután, lugar muy concurrido, ya que está rodeado de mucho comercio como bancos, restaurantes y otros más. Desde hace muchos años que ella se dedica a este trabajo, obteniendo ganancias muy aceptables, la cuales le han permitido a Ingrid salir adelante junto a su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de cosméticos, en diferentes marcas y precios, así mismo más accesorio para el cabello, ya que son estos de los productos que más se venden en el negocio. Ingrid cuenta con el deseo de seguir adelante y mejorar aún más en sus ventas y de esta manera crecer como comerciante.
texts.en:
Ingrid Yucira M. P. is 30 years old and resides in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her family which consists of her husband, who works for a private business, and her three children (ages 13, 11, and 9) who are in school. Ingrid has a vending post where she sells cosmetics, hair clips, men’s hair extensions, headbands, nail polish removers, and other products. Her business is located on the main street in Usulután, a well-known place that is surrounded by many commercial institutions such as banks, restaurants, and other establishments. Ingrid has worked many years in her business, which has helped her obtain acceptable earnings that allow her and her family to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can invest in her business. Ingrid will buy a large quantity of cosmetics of different brands and prices. At the same time, she will acquire more hair accessories since these products sell well in her business. Ingrid has the desire to succeed and improve her sales. This will help her grow as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & hair accessories

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Хаитова Адолат проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 44 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж в России на зарабатках. Сама Адолат более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Она в основном выращивает овощи. В этом ей помогают дети. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Adolat H. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 44 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband works in Russia. Adolat has been in agriculture for more than ten years. She mainly grows vegetables. Her children help her with it. She is taking out the loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertlizer

loans.name: Bebe Najeeba Group

texts.en:
Sohila is the group leader of the Bebe Najeeba group. She lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married with three children who are 12, 8 and 4. She does embroidery work. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years and is quite famous for her work in the neighborhood. 

She needs the loan to purchase required materials for her business and to expand her business as well. She would like to say that Kiva is a really effective process.

loans.use: To expand and progress her business

loans.name: Lilian Del Carmen

texts.es: Lilian del Carmen R. D. M. resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután,  vive junto a su esposo, el señor Osmín M. Rivera, quien es un maestro jubilado. Lilian posee un comedor y una venta D. pupusas, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa, la cual se encuentra cerca D. la parroquia del lugar, lo que contrae muchos beneficios para Lilian, ya que muchas personas transitan por este lugar. Ella se encarga D. elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo elabora pupusas en las mañanas y por las noches, debido a su gran dedicación, ella cuenta con muchos clientes quienes la conocen desD. hace muchos años y que prefieren consumir los productos que ella hace, ya que ha demostrado ser una persona muy dedicada a su trabaja, la cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos más cercanos. Lilian solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar verduras, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, frutas, queso y otros ingredientes más los cuales son básicos para los alimentos que ella prepara. Lo que más desea Lilian es poder mejorar su negocio y D. esta manera contar con mayor cantidad D. clientes.
texts.en:
Lilian del Carmen R. D. M. lives in the Department of Usulután with her husband, Sr. Osmín M. Rivera, who is a retired teacher. She manages a diner and sells pupusas from her home, which is located near the local parish. This location provides many benefits for Lilian since many people pass through this place. She is in charge of preparing breakfasts and lunches. At the same time, she makes pupusas in the mornings and then in the evenings with great dedication. She has many customers who have known her for many years and prefer to eat the food she prepares. Lilian has demonstrated that she is a person who is extremely dedicated to her work. She has good references from her neighbors who live very close.

Lilian is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy vegetables, rice, beans, fruits, cheese and other ingredients that are the basis for the meals that she prepares. What she desires most is to improve her business in a manner that will attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, rice, beans, fruits, cheese and other ingredients

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda L. is from the village of Tagoloan,  Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Linda is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Linda makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Linda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Linda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Azra Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Azra Parveen is a very hard working lady. She operates an embroider clothes business to share the financial burden with her husband. She earns approximately Pak Rs 8,000 from her embroider business. She also saves a part of her income after paying the expenses for rainy days.  
Her husband name is M. I. who has a cosmetics selling business. He sells the items on his cart by going to various places. By the grace of god he has obtained a good order from the cosmetic shops and to complete the order he needed of a capital therefore Azra has decided to apply for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 20,000 which would be a great help for I. to set a good reputation in the eyes of his new customers. 

She has applied with four other ladies. Zubaida wants a loan to buy an automatic sewing machine for her sewing clothes business. Shagufta wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and rice) for her food selling business. Nazia wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business. Mumtaz wants a loan to buy leather for her leather selling business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María B. D. M. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como vigilante para una empresa D. seguridad. Ana posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad como: granos básicos, bebidas, huevos y otros más, los cuales son muy necesario en los hogares. Es a través D. este negocio como Ana junto a su esposo cuentan con una estabilidad económica, ya que es así como ella le brinda ayuda para solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. alimentos, sobre todo aquellos, los cuales se comercializan por mayor, como el pan, las bebidas y golosinas, esto sería D. gran beneficio para Ana ya que le permitiría aumentar sus ventas y D. esta manera poseer un negocio muy estable, el cual pueda ser competencia D. otras tiendas en el alrededor. Ana es una mujer la cual desea mucho salir adelante y poder mejorar su calidad D. vida, y es gracias al préstamo hecho a Integral que ella podrá alcanzar esta meta.
texts.en:
Ana María B. D. M. is 40 years old and resides in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her husband who works as a guard for a security company. Ana manages a store where she sells basic necessities such as grains, beverages, eggs, and other items that are needed in the home. It is through this business that she is able to achieve financial stability as well as proviD. for all of the household expenses.

Ana is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of food items, particularly those sold in bulk such as bread, beverages, and candy. This will be of great benefit to Ana because it will allow her to increase her sales and create a more stable business, which will make it more competitive with other stores in the surrounding area. Ana is a woman who greatly desires to succeed and improve her quality of life. Thanks to the loan provided by Apoyo Integral, she will able to achieve this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma A. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis oriental. She is 40 years old. Alma is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: José Salvador

texts.es: José Salvador M. F. de 40 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa quien es su mano derecha en el negocio, y le ayuda en todo lo necesario, y junto a sus dos hijos de 16 y 17 años de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. José posee una venta de zapatos para niños, mujeres y adultos, la cual está ubicada sobre la carretera panamericana, siempre en las cercanías de San Martín, un lugar muy concurrido tanto con habitantes del lugar como por turistas. Poco a poco José ha ido invirtiendo lo que ha estado dentro de sus capacidades en el negocio, aunque en muchas ocasiones le ha sido muy difícil por el hecho de verse en la necesidad de invertir la mayoría de sus ganancias en los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que él solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda invertir en su venta, comprar mayor cantidad de zapatos, en diferentes tallas, estilos y colores, esto con el deseo de poder mejorar sus ganancias y de esta manera mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
José Salvador M. F. is 40 years old and resides in the town of San Martín, which is located in the Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife who is the right hand of the business and helps with everything that is necessary. They have two children, ages 16 and 17, who are in school.

José has a vending post where he sells shoes for children, women, and men. It is located along the Panamerican Highway which is on the outskirts of San Martín. This place is abuzz with both locals and tourists. José has been gradually investing into his business, but there have been several times in which it has been difficult because most of his earnings have been going toward household expenses. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral to invest in his retail business. He will buy a large quantity of shoes in different sizes, styles, and colors. José hopes to improve his income as well as strengthen the financial stability of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes L. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Agnes owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Agnes joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rhenee

texts.en:
Rhenee P. believes that poverty is not a hindrance to one’s success. Being a member of ASHI, the Kiva field partner in the Philippines, she feels privileged for having such great help. Through the institution’s financial assistance she has been able to start an inland fishing business that gives her the ability to support her rice farming business. Proceeds of these businesses have allowed Rhenee’s family to obtain their basic needs and to improve their quality of life. 

Their 13-year-old child is not yet needing a large amount of money for his education. However, Rhenee wants to save some of her profits in order to send her child to a good college after completing a secondary school with high standards. With her husband partnering her in the business, Rhenee is requesting a 49,000 PHP loan to purchase materials for manufacturing a “balsa” (a raft) to be used for fishing and to increase the volume of fish they sell. That will allow them to fulfill the increasing demands of their customers as well as increase their profit.

loans.use: To purchase materials for manufacturing a "balsa" or raft for fishing.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma G. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro. She is 37 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities. (The photograph shows Emma and her husband in the sari-sari store.)
In 2009, Emma joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna B. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married, and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Myrna has a retail business, primarily selling household items. She generates a monthly net income of 2,500 PHP from this business.
In 2005, Myrna joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to credit services in order to expand her business. She is now on her third loan and has repaid her previous loans on time. With the proceeds from her business, she has been able to support her family's needs.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace E. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Grace owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Mary Grace joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita D. is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Barangay Delicioso, Ilog, Negros Occidental.  She is married and has seven adult-aged children.  To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling different products in the local community.  Margarita has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately $220 a month from these activities.

In May of 1999, Margarita joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from NWTF. Margarita is now requesting a new loan of 29,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be her 16th loan from NWTF.  Margarita plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand the business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called "honorable", meaning that they have earned the respect of their community through hard work and determination. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.en:
Mr. Bernardino C. is a resident of D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 74 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. He has managed his own sari-sari store (small general store) for almost three years. He is able to earn a monthly net income of 5,400 PHP from this business.
In 2008, Mr. Bernardino joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services from the co-op. He is now on his third loan and has repaid his previous loans on time. Mr. Bernardino is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP. The proceeds from this loan will be used as additional capital for his current business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for his business

loans.name: Adelarda

texts.en:
Adelarda M. is from the village of D'ban, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 67 years old and a widow with 3 adult children. She has owned and managed her flower farm for 25 years with a monthly net income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which is about $219 US. Through her business she has been able to support her family.

In 2002, she joined PMPC to gain access the financial services extended by the co-op.  After successfully repaying a previous loan, her fifth, she is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP that will be used as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for flower farm

loans.name: Zabiullah Panjsheri Group

texts.en: Fariba is the group leader of Zabiullah Panjsheri group and lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She and her husband have three children, who are in school. She wants to take out a loan for her home-based bakery, and will use this money to buy stock for her business as well as help her husband and her children. Finally, she wants to thank all lenders of Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.use: Stock for a bakery

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely G. is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family selling meat in the local market. She lives in Omilis, Cauayan, Negros Occidental with her husband and their four children, who are 3 – 16 years old with three of them currently going to school. Fely has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her local meat market business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Fely is now borrowing 17,000 PHP to use as additional capital for her buy and sell meat business. This will be her 17th loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Fely aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mirzorahim

texts.ru: Ашуров Мирзорахим проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Мирзорахим занимается торговлей. У него торговая точка, где он продает топливо. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 8 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mirzorahim A. lives in the town of Kulyab. He is 50 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker. Mirzorahim is in retail sales. He has a vendor point where he sells fuel. He has been in this business for eight years. He is taking out the loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales volume

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza S. is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Central Lopez, Sagay City. She is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Liza owns and operates a restaurant serving local foods to customers in her community. Liza has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2003, Liza joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from NWTF. Liza is now requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF. Liza plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to her house. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of – not just a few – but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is the leader of this group of ladies. They all belong to a city named Borewala, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan.

Her husband name is H. M. who is a mechanic and works in a motor workshop on meager income. He is an expert in his profession but due to no financial resource he couldn’t quit from his job. Nusrat always supports him in every circumstance and gives him motivation to overcome on the problems. 

She operates a sewing clothes business to supplement the income with her husband to meet the financial expenses. She is applying for a loan to buy repairing tools for her husband so he starts his own motor workshop and gets the expected income of his struggle.

Manzooran wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and rice) for her food stand. 
Majidan wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 
Shamim wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business.

loans.use: To buy repairing tools for starting motor workshop

loans.name: María Vilma

texts.es: María Vilma M. de 47 reside en Santa Tecla ubicado departamento de La Libertad, vive  junto a dos hijos mayores de edad, los cuales trabajan y junto a dos nietos. María posee una tienda, en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad tales como: granos básicos, pan, leche, huevos y otros más. Su tienda es bastante grande y posee gran variedad de productos, lo que le permite contar con muchos clientes, los cuales se sienten muy satisfechos con el servicio brindado por María. Este negocio es un pilar fundamental en el sostenimiento de su hogar, por lo cual cuenta con el deseo de poder mejorarlo, ya que es gracias a las ganancias obtenidas por este que ella ha logrado salir adelante, María solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar comida para perro, para gatos, mayor cantidad de granos básicos y bebidas, productos los cuales en la actualidad cuenta con mayor demanda. De esta manera ella espera mejorar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María Vilma M. is 47 years old and resides in Santa Tecla, located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her two adult children, who are working, and her two grandchildren. María manages a store where she sells basic necessities such as grain, bread, milk, eggs, and other items. Her store is large enough for her to sell a wide variety of products. She has many customers who are very satisfied with the service she provides. This business is fundamental to sustaining her household. She has the desire to improve, and thanks to the income she has earned, she will be able to get ahead.

María is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy dog food, cat food, and large quantities of grains and beverages. These products are currently in great demand. She hopes to improve her sales as well as her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pet food, grain, and beverages

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen M. is from the village of Kimanait, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Carmen is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Carmen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Carmen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. She opted to request a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Carmen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en: Genelyn T. runs a sari sari store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Central Lopez, Sagay City. She is married and has one school-age child. Genelyn has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) month. In 2003, Genelyn joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Genelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from NWTF. She is now requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF. Genelyn plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of – not just a few – but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional product to sell

loans.name: María Ana

texts.es: María Ana A. M. de 43 años de edad, reside en Antiguo Cuscatlán, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa arrendada. María posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual la comercializa de forma ambulante por todas las calles de Antiguo Cuscatlán, ella posee un pick up, en el cual coloca su mercadería, y de esta manera comercializa su producto, llevándolo hasta las puertas de los hogares. Desde hace cuatro años que ella se dedica a este trabajo, logrando obtener muchos clientes los cuales le compran frutas o verduras en cada ocasión que ella llega a sus colonias. María solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar frutas y verduras por mayor, con el fin de poder obtenerla a menores precios y así ofrecerla de una forma más competitiva en el mercado. También solicita dicho préstamo para llevar su automóvil a revisión, ya que es este uno de los elementos más básicos para su negocio. María desea prosperar y seguir adelante con sus ventas, y de esta manera ganarse la vida de una manera adecuada.
texts.en:
María Ana A. M. is 43 years old and resides in Antiguo Cuscatlán, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives in a rented house with her partner in life. María has a fruit and vegetable stand that she takes with her as she travels through the streets of Antiguo Cuscatlán. Her pickup truck holds the merchandise and enables her to sell her products and deliver them to the doors of her customers’ homes. María has been in this business for four years and has been able to attract many customers who buy fruits or vegetables every time she arrives in their neighborhood.

She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy fruits and vegetables in bulk to get the lowest prices. This will help her become more competitive in the market. She will also use part of her loan to get her vehicle inspected because it is one of the most important elements for her business. María wants to prosper and move forward with her sales so that she can earn a living in an appropriate manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables; pay for a vehicle inspection

location.town: Antiguo Cuscatlán, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia E. is a 49 year-old woman living in the town of Brgy 9, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakery. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking and selling bread in the local community. Delia has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 1997, Delia joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from NWTF. Delia is now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. The loan will be her 19th loan from NWTF.  Delia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., has answered the call of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients.

loans.name: Marta Victoria

texts.es: Marta Victoria C. D. H. D. 52 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus tres hijos. Marta se dedica a la confección D. prendas D. vestir, las cuales en su mayoría son elaboradas con pedidos previos, y en otras ocasiones ella cose para poder tener ropa a la venta, D. manera que pueda contar con una ganancia extra. DesD. hace 7 años que ella se dedica a este oficio, logrando obtener muchos clientes y al mismo tiempo muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus clientas quienes la recomiendan con mucho fe en ella. Marta solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. tela en diferentes colores y estampados, esto lo hace con el fin D. poder aceptar más trabajo y D. esta manera obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales la beneficien en gran manera, sobre todo porque ella es madre soltera y debe luchar por el bienestar D. sus hijos, quienes son su principal motivo para seguir adelante y esforzarse por ser mejor.
texts.en:
Marta Victoria C. D. H. is 52 years old and lives with her three children in Santa Tecla, which is in the Department of La Libertad. Marta manufactures garments, most of which are produced based on submitted orders. On occasion she will produce a few items to sell on her own so that she can earn some extra income. Marta has been in this business for seven years and has attracted many customers. At the same time, she has garnered very good references because her customers have recommended her with great confidence.

Marta is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can have the necessary funds to buy a large quantity of fabric in different colors and patterns. She hopes to be able to take in more work so that she can generate more income, which will benefit her in a great way. Since she is a single mother, Marta fights for the welfare of her children who are her main source of motivation to continue striving to be better.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric in different colors & patterns

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Balibaseka Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Christine, shown at the top left in the small photo, also appears in the big group photo as the group leader. She is a 43-year-old single mother of six and is, on the face of it, a happy-go-lucky woman. With the kind of business she is engaged in (selling produce), this trait presumably works in her favor.

In Seeta where Christine has been operating from for the last twenty years, her reputation has gained currency. This is on the grounds of her impressive business line of operation. Her customer base has grown by leaps and bounds over the years as a result of her exemplary customer relationship skills. Her only let down has been customers who pay her in kind and in installments.

In a month, Christine calculates she makes 100,000 shillings. By her own account, this is not enough for her to achieve her dreams of expansion. She is very optimistic that, with a loan, there will be a favorable turn in her circumstances.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Bernaditha

texts.en:
Bernaditha D. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Bernaditha is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Bernaditha owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products and a variety of viands in the local community. In 2009, Bernaditha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernaditha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Bernaditha from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bulilan's Group

texts.en:
Guadalupe B. is from the village of Canubay. She is 54 years old. Guadalupe is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Guadalupe is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Guadalupe owns & operates a "sari-sari" store, essentially a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.

Guadalupe has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2006, Guadalupe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guadalupe has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Guadalupe is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Guadalupe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of the borrower's immediate family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As working capital, and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn T. is a 50 year-old woman living in the town of So. Macapso, Vallehermoso, Neg. Oriental. She is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Marilyn has just started operating this business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 1998, Marilyn joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,500 PHP from NWTF. Marilyn is now requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the 17th loan taken out by the borrower from NWTF. Marilyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., has answered the call of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy additional working capital.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky T. hopes that the loan she has requested will enable her to grow her food selling business to make more profit and thus help her support her dream of rising up from all forms of poverty starting by increasing her income. Despite her poverty and the small profit of her business at the moment, Vicky believes that in time it will grow and she can give her three children (aged two to nine years old) a life that they will be most happy. She wants her children to attain the highest level of education possible to have more options to cope with life’s challenges.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and other things needed for her food preparation/sales business.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita C. is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Brgy 9, Isabela, Negros Occidental.  She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Anecita owns and operates a business venture in the sector of operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling animal feed and farm-related products in the local community. Anecita has been engaged in this business for over 14 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 1997, Anecita joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,000 PHP from NWTF. Anecita is now requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 17th loan taken out from NWTF. Anecita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., has answered the calls of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita P. is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Prk 2 Brgy Nabali-an, Himamaylan City Negros Occidental. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling animal feed and farm-related products in the local community. Anita has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2000, Anita joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from NWTF. Anita is now requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 20th loan taken out by the borrower from NWTF. Anita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., has answered the calls of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.name: Vick

texts.en:
Vick P. is from the village of Langcataon, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Vick is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Vick owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Vick has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 13,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vick joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vick has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. Vick is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her offering of products. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Vick from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her offering of products

loans.name: Amantai

texts.en:
Amantai is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Bayan-Ulgii province in Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two sons attend a local secondary school.

Amantai operates a meat trading business with her husband. She started her business in 1999 and has gained much experience over the years. Amantai's husband purchases livestock at wholesale prices in the countryside. Amantai and her husband slaughter the livestock and sell the meat to retailers for a profit. Their daily revenue exceeds 60,000 tugrugs (~$45 USD), and their business profit margin is 30%. The meat trading business requires a lot of hard work, including slaughtering the livestock and preparing the meat for sale to traders. However, they cooperate with local restaurants, and they have a loyal customer base which brings in a lot of profit for them.

With their business profits, they provide the money for their family's expenses and, besides that, they purchased a personal computer for their children's education with the XacBank installment. Amantai says, “I would like to save money for my two sons' education fees.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Martha Emilia

texts.es: Martha Emilia
texts.en: Martha Emilia

loans.use: Purchase dried fish

loans.name: Susan Muthoni

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old. She operates a small shop at Uthiru trading center where she sells things such as salt, cooking oil, washing detergent, boxes of matches, etc. This is her primary business and she has been running it for three years. Her customers are mainly neighbors from around the area of Kinoo.

Susan was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by an existing member and this is her second loan with KADET. She has not borrowed from other financial institutions. Her business is still very young and small, so Susan hopes that with this loan she will be able to add more stock and grow it substantially.

loans.use: To buy stock such as bread, cooking oil, washing detergent etc.

loans.name: Rhina Maribel

texts.es: Rhina Maribel C. D. M. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La paz, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos D. 21, 19 y 14 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. La señora Rhina posee una panadería, en la cual se dedica a trabajar desD. hace 16 años atras, es por esta razón que ella es muy conocida en la zona ya que siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora la cual entrega todos los pedidos a tiempo y que cuenta con muy buenos estándares D. calidad. En muchas ocasiones sus hijos le ayudan a repartir el pan por los diferentes lugares en donD. posee clientes fijos. Rhina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, manteca, miel, azúcar y otros ingredientes más, los cuales son necesarios para la elaboración del pan. Rhina trabaja arduamente día con día para poder brindarles todo lo mejor a sus hijos, y así también poder mejorar el negocio, el cual ha sido muy rentable para ella.
texts.en:
Rhina Maribel C. D. M. is 45 years old and lives in the department of La Paz, where she lives together with her husband and three children who are 21, 19, and 14 years old, and are all students. Rhina owns a bakery, where she has been working for the past 16 years. It is for this reason that she is very well-known in the area, since she has always been a very hardworking woman who completes orders on time and has very good standards of quality. Many times, her children help her to deliver the bread in the different places where she has regular clients. Rhina is requesting a loan through which she can purchase flour, butter, honey, sugar and other ingredients necessary for making bread. Rhina works hard day after day to be able to proviD. all the best to her children and improve the business, which has been very profitable for her.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw material for making bread

loans.name: Metoshela

texts.en:
Metoshela T. is from the town of  Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 32 years old and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, she buys and sells cashew nuts in the local community — a business she has carried out for over four years and which earns her approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Metoshela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Metoshela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Metoshela is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Metoshela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing  accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Cristina Jeanette

texts.es: Cristina Jeanette N. M. de 26 años de edad,  reside en el departamento de Usulután, junto a su padre y sus dos hermanos mayores, de los cuales uno trabaja como comerciante y el otro como albañil. Cristina es madre soltera de un hijo de 4 años de edad, por el cual lucha día con día para brindarle todo lo necesario. Ella posee un comedor en el mercado municipal de Jiquilisco, lugar en el cual posee muchos clientes, los cuales en su mayoría son personas que trabajan en el mismo lugar. Ella se encarga de elaborar desayunos y almuerzos y diferentes tipos de bebidas naturales. Cristina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de frutas, verduras, granos básicos y otros más, los cuales son la materia prima para elaborar los platillos. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo de poder mejorar sus ventas y de esta manera contribuir con los gastos del hogar, y brindarle todo lo que su hijo necesita como alimentación ropa y hogar.
texts.en:
Cristina is 26 years old and lives in the Usulután department with her father and two older brothers, one of whom works as a businessman and the other as a mason. Cristina is the single mother of a four year old son, whom she struggles daily to provide for. She has a food stall in the city marketplace in Jiquilisco and has many customers, most of whom work in the same location. She prepares breakfast and lunches and different types of natural beverages. Cristina is asking for this loan in order to buy fruits, vegetables, basic grains (corn and beans) and other ingredients that she uses to prepare her dishes. She does this in hopes that she will increase her sales and be able to better contribute toward the household expenses and continue to provide for her son’s needs, such as food, clothing, and a home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mr. C. is a rural villager, 32 years old, who lives in the capital of Phnom Penh. Here, he makes a living as a publisher in the cloth publishing company and earns a salary of $150 a month, which he uses to support his family’s daily living expenses. C. has a life partner in his wife who works sewing clothes in factory and is also a good homemaker, cooking tasty meals for the family. They have two school-aged kids who are dependent on their income. C. saw that the poultry-raising trade operated by his neighbor is a profitable one and he hopes to invest in this sector in order to make additional income for family. However, he doesn’t have money for this propose. Thus, he looks for a $1,200 loan which will enable him to purchase one thousand small chickens to raise in a stall he built. Note: Mr. C. was not available for photographing, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a thousand small chickens.

loans.name: Mandah

texts.en: Mandah is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. They have lived there for 10 years. He and his wife operate a transportation business he started in 2000. Mandah's wife has responsibility for finances and finding new customers. They have grown the business and built a loyal customer base. In the beginning he generally provided transportation to people, but now he is more focused on transporting large objects and packages. He purchased two trucks a few years ago and rotates them for his business. Mandah has gained a lot of experience and is a very hardworking person. He says, “I would like to build a larger house and improve my family's quality of life in the future.” He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrugs (~ 1760 USD) loan to purchase four tires for his trucks.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his truck

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia M. is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store and cafeteria business. She lives in Bagumbayan, Valladolid, Negros Occidental with her 57 year old husband, Remias, and works as a driver. They have 3 children who are 24 to 30 years of age. With the eldest already working in Manila while their youngest has her own family, Herminia and Remias' second daughter still lives with them because of her special condition that needs care and attention.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and cafeteria business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Herminia is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she could expand her general store and cafeteria business. This will be her 17th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Herminia aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy additonal working capital.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana D. R. is a 41-year old married woman who lives in Bagumbayan, Valladolid Negros Occidental. She earns a living by operating her general store, cafeteria and food vending businesses.

Ana’s husband, Ireneo, is 41 years old and works at a buy and sell of scrap business.  They have 2 children ages between 7 to 12 years old who are currently going to school.  They also help their parents as part of their daily chores.

Ana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by starting the general store, cafeteria and food vending businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000.

Her previous loan of Php 20,000 was used to fund operations of her businesses, and had a positive impact on her family’s living conditions.  Ana is a member in good standing. Now she is borrowing for her 13th cycle loan, the amount of Php 20,000, which she intends to use to support her businesses. Ana is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.
----------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.
