The other four members are: Ms. Awa N. who sells vegetables; Ms. Coura N. who sells fresh fish at the Grand Thiès market; Ms. Fatou Sakho N. who sells vegetables at the market; and Ms. Isseu T. who sells breakfast and vegetables at the Okass market.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop their respective commercial activities

loans.name: Tzucubal 2 Group

texts.es: El Grupo de Tzucubal NO.2 Acuden a la Asociaciòn ASDIR para pedir el apoyo para incrementar sus capitales ya que ellas se dedican a la compra y venta de ropa tipica nueva y usada para venderlos a otros lugares de la republica de Guatemala y con ello ganan para el sustento de cada dìa, y mantienen a sus familias  y por eso piden la ayuda  para capitalizar y comprar màs mercaderia y tener surtido las ventas y asi poder ganar màs.-
texts.en:
The Group Tzucubal No. 2 is turning to ASDIR to request support in increasing their working capital. They buy and sell typical regional clothing, either new or used. Their sales are in other parts of Guatemala. This is the way they support themselves and their families, for this reason they ask for financial support, to be able to purchase more merchandise and thus increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en edad escolar en una vivienda propia ubicada en el sector Los Aguilares, una zona rural del distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde que tiene 18 años de edad a la crianza y venta de animales menores. El cría ovejas, chivos y aves de corral en un ambiente ubicado a un costado de su vivienda para luego comercializarlos a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Por las mañanas suele soltar a sus animales para que estos consuman la algarroba (fruto del arbol del algarrobo) que abunda por la zona, ya que el lugar esta rodeado de bosques secos. Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingreso económico con la que cuenta, también se dedica a trabajar como chofer de transporte de carga en algunas ocasiones pero este trabajo no le provee de ingresos permanentes.

La dedicación que le otorga a su negocio ha hecho que sus animales tengan bastante demanda por su calidad, actualmente José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para engordarlos y venderlos, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Jose es un padre bastante entregado a su trabajo y que siempre vela por el bienestar de los suyos. Su mayor anhelo es hacer mejoras en su vivienda que está construida de material rústico. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institucion y ha demostrado responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José is a 46-year-old family man. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. They own their home which is in the Los Aguilares area, a rural area in the Pítipo district which is one hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked raising and selling small animals since he was 18 years old. He raises sheep, billy goats and free range birds next to his house and then sells them to buyers who usually visit the area. He usually sets his animals free in the morning so that they can eat the carob (fruit of the carob tree) which is abundant in the area since this place is surrounded by dry woods. This business is the main source of income that he counts on. He also works as a truck driver at times but this work doesn’t provide him with a steady income. He is dedicated to his business therefore his animals are in high demand due to their quality. Currently José wishes to expand his business by purchasing more animals to raise and sell. That is why he saw it was necessary to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 700 PEN which will help him reach his objectives. Jose is a father who is dedicated to his work and he always worries about his family’s well being. His biggest wish is to do home improvement in his home which is built of rustic material. He has worked before with our institution and he has shown responsibility when taking care of his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Ganiatou

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, A. Ganiatou est mariée à ADILEOU Hervé un tailleur. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Ganiatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à PK10 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, il y a une dizaine d'année. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges familiales. N'ayant jamais été à l'école, Ganiatou vend des tissus, et de façon secondaire des chaussures, par le système de distribution. Ganiatou s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Ganiatou exerce cette activité depuis huit ans, et a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de l'institution, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Dans l’optique d’élargir son domaine d’activité et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits, Ganiatou désire bénéficier d’un deuxième concours financier auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Ganiatou A. is married to Hervé ADILEOU, a tailor. The couple has three children to care for, of whom two are their own children. For the past ten years Ganiatou has lived with her children and her husband at PK10 in the Sèmè-Podji commune. The couple jointly shares family expenses. Never having attended school, Ganiatou retails pieces of fabric, and also shoes as a secondary activity, through the distribution system. She gets her supplies from Lomé in Togo, a country adjacent to Benin. Ganiatou has been in this line of business for the past eight years, and has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was repaid in full. Wishing to expand the range of her activities and increase her stock supply, she is seeking a second financial loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: José Reynaldo

texts.es:
El señor José Reynaldo S. M., tiene la edad de 62 años vive en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla es casado y su esposa realiza los trabajos domésticos, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad y casados.

Hace un tiempo su esposa tuvo un accidente y quedo con su pie lisiado, es por esta razón que él solicita de un préstamo para invertirlo en el hogar y realizar cambios en la infraestructura del mismo,  que le traigan mejores condiciones, debido a la afectación que sufre la señora, con el préstamo se compraran los materiales de construcción, necesarios para realizar los cambios debidos, este apoyo que se le brinde a la familia será de mucha ayuda a que la señora y su esposo habiten en un lugar mas cómodo y seguro para todos.
texts.en:
Mr. José Reynaldo S. M. is 62 years old, lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla suburb. He is married, his wife works in the home, they have 3 grown children that are married. Some time ago, his wife had an accident that left her with a crippled foot. He is requesting this loan to be able to make structural changes to his house, improving the conditions for his wife. The loan will allow him to purchase the necessary materials for the desired construction. This financial support will be of great help to the family, allowing them to live in a more comfortable and safe place.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts for the production of red oil

loans.name: Las Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo D. personas residen en la Aldea Nahualate I San Antonio Such, y solicitaron un crédito en la  
Asociación ASDIR, debido a que estas personas comercializan en el centro D. San Antonio y Municipios 
circunvecinos, estas personas venden lo que es pollo y hojas D. maxan para la elaboración D. comidas  y son 
D. tipo ambulante y por eso tuvieron la necesidad D. solicitar un préstamo a la asociación para así poder 
darle continuidad a sus ventas y algunas a darle inicio a la comercialización D. su producto como la crianza D.  
pollos. Se ha visto como estas personas han venido superando y atreves del  apoyo D. la asociación su negocio incrementará y ayudara  a que su familia tenga una mejor calidad D. vida, y así poder cubrir los gastos que se generan en el hogar, ya que actualmente sus ingresos han venido mejorando sus ventas y la producción del mismo.
texts.en:
This group of people lives in the Nahualate I San Antonio Such village; they requested a loan from Asociación ASDIR because they are merchants in downtown San Antonio and neighboring municipalities. Their main products are chicken and maxan leaves (used in the manufacture of certain dishes, like tamales). They do not sell from fixed locations but, rather, move from place to place. For this reason they needed to ask for funding from the association in order to be able to continue with their sales. Some need funding to start their business, such as chicken-raising. We have seen how these people have been improving themselves and, with help from the association, have helped their business grow. This helps their families have a better quality of life and they are able to meet household expenses. Their income, sales and production have all been improving.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for their businesses (chicken raising and maxan leaf sales)

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes N°3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Femmes Commerçantes (F.C) comme son nom l’indique est un réseau de femmes qui s’activent  dans le commerce.  Il est basé à Grand Thiès et il a été créé depuis 1992 par Madame Maty Niakh l’actuel président du réseau. Cette présidente a eu cette idée  à l’issue d’une formation qu’elle avait bénéficiée  de l’ONG OXFAM à Thiès. Elle connait, ainsi, bien la gestion de groupe, entreprenariat …etc.  Les membres du réseau sont extrêmement dévoués et se rencontrent une fois par mois. Ainsi, après des frais d’adhésion au groupement, chaque membre est tenu de cotiser mensuellement 200 FCFA pour une caisse de solidarité.
Souhaitant se financer, elles décidèrent  d’adhérer à  U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que,  leur réseau se voit scinder en 19 sous groupes de 5 personnes  pour un meilleur profit des financements. Elles sollicitent pour une deuxième fois un prêt de 100 000 FCFA par membre,  soit 500 000 FCFA par sous groupe afin de développer leurs diverses activités.
Cependant, les règlements sont versés à la présidente assistée par la trésorière du groupe, Madame Coumba Seck, pendant leurs réunions mensuelles et ces deux se chargent à leur tour de rembourser U-IMCEC. Ce réseau qui, dit la présidente, n’a qu’un seul et noble objectif : combattre la pauvreté dans les ménages. Actuellement, le réseau compte 19 sous groupes avec chacun une présidente et une trésorière.
Le sous groupe Femmes Commerçantes N°3 a comme présidente Madame Kanane Rose N.  âgé de 47 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait le commerce de légumes, huile de palme depuis 15 ans. Madame Khardiata O. âgée de 41 ans et trésorière du sous groupe vend des légumes depuis 12 ans au marché Grand Thiès. Les autres membres sont Madame Sokhna Touré Cissé qui vend des poissons séchés au marché, Madame Fatou L. vendeuse d’huile de palme et de gombo et Madame Fatou N.  qui vend du petit déjeuner dans sa maison.
texts.en:
As its name suggests, Femmes Commerçantes is a network of businesswomen, It is based at Grand Thiès and was created in 1992 by Mme Maty Niakh, its current president. She got the idea of forming the network after.benefiting from belonging to ONG OXFAM at Thiès, and was familiar with group organization and running a business. The members of the group are dedicated to what they do, and meet together once a month. Over and above membership dues, each of them pays 200 FCFA a month into a group operating fund. Looking for financing, they decided to join U-IMCEC. The network is divided into 19 subgroups of five people so that financing can be better handled. Each subgroup has its own president and treasurer. They now seek, for the second time, a loan of 100,000 FCFA per member or 500,000 FCFA for each subgroup, to grow their various activities. The members repay their loans to the president and the treasurer, Mme Coumba Seck. They, in turn, are responsible for repaying U-IMCEC. According to the president, the group has one praiseworthy objective -- to fight family poverty. Subgroup 3's president is Mme Kanane Rose N., 47 years old with three children. For 15 years she has been in the business of selling legumes and palm oil. Mme Khardiata O., 41 years old, is treasurer, and for 12 years has been selling legumes in the market at Grand Thiès. The other members are Mme Sokhna Touré Cissé, who sells dried fish in the market, Mme Fatou L., who sells palm oil and stew, and Mme Fatou N., who sells breakfast from her home.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Yenny Stand

texts.es:
Yenni V. S. tiene 31 años vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos de 1, 3 y 7 años en  el barrio las Nieves, uno de los más tradicionales y populosos del suroriente de Barranquilla, en  casa de sus padres donde todo lo que se mueve es negocio:  por el lado de ella en su vitrina calentadora  vende semanalmente alimentos y  frituras como sopas, picadas, chorizos, chinchurria, cuajo y vende diariamente dulces y frutas como alegrías, masmelos, supercoco, mango, corozo, pera, papaya, por otro lado  su esposo trabaja  vendiendo pescado camarón y en general  productos del mar.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación y solicita un valor de $2.000.000  que quiere invertir en la compra de un Carricoche para transportar pasajeros, el cual  será conducido por su esposo y en él también ofrecerá sus productos alimentarios,  porque Yenni aspira a tener un ingreso diario mas constante y este es un medio que suele utilizarse en ese barrio para transportarse internamente y hacia otros sectores cercanos. 
Aprendió a negociar viendo a su madre desde que ella  era niña,  pues  tenia este mismo negocio y hace apenas unos 7 años se lo dejó a Yenni. Su crédito anterior le sirvió para surtir su negocio, pagar pasivos costosos que cobraban altos intereses. Su sueño y desafío actual es tener su propia casa y ver a sus hijos crecer y educarse para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Yenni V. S. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and their 3 children, ages 1,3, and 7 years. They live in the Las Nieves neighborhood, one of the most traditional and heavily populated areas in the southeast part of Barranquilla. They live in her parent's home, where they also have their business. On her side, in a heated glass display case, she sells food and fried food such as soups, cold cuts, sausages, pork rinds, and rennet on a weekly basis, and on a daily basis she sells sweets and fruits, including sweets made of chocolate, marshmallow, coconut, and fruits such as mango, corozo, pears, and papaya. On the other side her husband works selling fish, shrimp and other seafood. This is their second loan with the Fundación and they request an amount of 2,000,000 Colombian pesos that they want to invest in the purchase of a light vehicle to transport passengers. Her husband will drive this vehicle, and they will also use it to offer their food products for sale, because Yenni wants to have a daily income that is more reliable. This is a medium that is often used for transportation over short distances and to other nearby neighborhoods. She learned to sell watching her mother from the time she was a child. Now she has this same business, which was left to Yenni 7 years ago. Her previous loan was used to restock her store and to pay off other debts that were charging a high rate of interest. Her dream and current challenge is to have her own house and to see her children grow and become educated for a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a light vehicle to transport food products and passengers

loans.name: Los Planes 4 Group

texts.es: El grupo los planes 4 se han dedicado a la elaboraciòn de cintas y fajas de mostacillas y  delantales para damas con unos 6 años a tras y ellas con esto han salido avante  pero por la demanda  ellas quieren incrementar sus capitales  y por ello acuden ala  ASOCIACIÒN ASDIR para poder ayudarlas en sus capitales  para tener màs venta y surtir sus meraderias y asi ganar  y tener otro nivel de vida y superar en toda el area de su vivencia.-
texts.en:
The "Los Planes 4" group manufactures beaded sashes and belts and aprons for women; they have been in this line of work for 6 years. Demand has been high and this has made it possible for them to get ahead. They need an increase incapital so they have called upon ASOCIACIÒN ASDIR to request funds to buy merchandise in order to increase sales and profits so that their standard of living will rise and their entire way of life will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr: Née le 27 Février 1964 à Kétou au Bénin, D. Mariam est mariée à SOUMANOU Yaya, un chauffeur. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont quatre sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariam  vient en aide à son mari et supporte avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. C'est depuis 20 ans que Mariam exerce l'activité de la vente de produits de soins (dentifrices, brosses à dents, savons, etc.) à son domicile. Mariam s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariam a bénéficié une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué les remboursements. Mariam désire augmenter son fonds de roulement et renforcer son activité, afin d'être plus compétitive sur le marché et se faire plus de revenu. C'est ce qui amène Mariam à solliciter auprès de ALIDé, un second prêt.
texts.en:
Born 27 February 1964 in Kétou in Benin, Mariam D. is married to Yaya SOUMANOU, a driver. The couple cares for five children, of whom four are their own. All the children have had schooling and live together with their parents in the Sèmè-Podji commune. Mariam helps her husband in dealing with the various family expenses. Some twenty years ago, Mariam started retailing personal care products from her home (toothpaste, toothbrushes, soap, etc.). She gets her supplies from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Mariam has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was correctly repaid in full. She wants to increase her turnover and reinforce her activity, so that she can become more competitive in her line of business and generate more income. This is why she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cartons of toothpaste, toothbrushes and soap

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina R. E. tiene 53 años  y vive en el barrio las Palmas de la Ciudad de Barranquilla, con sus dos hijos  de 24 y 26 años de edad.  Su negocio lleva por nombre “ Variedades Luz”, allí  vende mercancías y tiene una pequeña sala de Internet y de servicios  de telefonía celular; en la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 para comprar mercancías como calzado, vestuarios para damas y caballeros, perfumes shampoo y ropa interior; Inició su negocio en el año 2002, cuando vendía mercancía mediante guías especializadas de productos cosméticos y fue la forma de ayudar a mejorar sus ingresos familiares,  porque ella sola afrontó el sostenimiento de su familia, a este negocio fue agregándole otras mercancías ,  servicios de llamadas, a celulares y un equipo de informática con Internet, todo esto es los que en la actualidad tiene.
Los créditos en la Fundación le han ayudado a cambiar su vida porque con ellos  ha logrado incrementar las ventas y  apoyada con capacitación ha mejorado la administración de su negocio, en la medida en que ha ido creciendo.
Ella quiere seguir ampliándolo, sueña con tener  un local propio con activos y equipos necesarios y ahora lleva un gran paso, que es el de la legalización y formalización de su negocio, ante la Cámara de Comercio pues ya tiene su registro mercantil.

Hasta le fecha el negocio ha manejado una regularidad  en las ventas producto de su organización, responsabilidad y por el potencial de clientes que existe en su  entorno de  gente emprendedora, con mucho civismo y capacidad de compra de sus productos y servicios.
texts.en:
Luz Marina R. E., 53, lives in Barranquilla’s Las Palmas neighborhood with her two sons, who are 24 and 26 years of age. Her store is called “Variedades Luz;” she sells general merchandise and provides a small Internet access and cell phone service. She is asking for a $2.000.000 loan to buy merchandise like: shoes, women’s and men’s clothing, perfumes, shampoo and underwear. She started her business in 2002 selling catalogue cosmetics as a way of improving family income because she was the sole provider for her family. She gradually started adding other products to her sales as well as phone services and Internet access services; this is everything she has as of now. The Fundación’s loans have helped her to change her life because she has managed to increase sales and, with the training received, has learned how to manage her business better as it has grown. She wants to continue to expand; she dreams with having her own location with assets and necessary equipment and she is taking a big step in that direction, which is the legalization and formalizing of her business with the Chamber of Commerce; she now has her business license. To date, the business has maintained steady sales thanks to her organization, responsibility and the potential customer base of enterprising, civic oriented people with buying power that exists around her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, men's and women's clothing, perfumes, shampoo and underwear.

loans.name: Aura Estela's Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de personas residen en el municipio de San José el Ídolo, y solicitaron un crédito en la  
Asociación ASDIR, debido a que estas personas comercializan en el centro y aldeas de dicho municipio y en áreas
circunvecinas, estas personas venden lo que es ropa, comida y artículos varios y son de tipo ambulante y tienen 
la necesidad de solicitar el crédito para poder seguir comercializando su producto en las diferentes comunidades 
y así darle continuidad a sus ventas. Se ha visto como estas personas han venido superando a través de estas ventas yaque han logrado apoyar a sus hijos con una educación a nivel primario, básico como también diversificado ya que anteriormente únicamente contaban con los ingresos de sus esposos el cual no era suficiente para que    pudieran cubrir todos los gastos que se generaban en el hogar, pero actualmente sus ingresos han venido mejorando de esta forma es como este grupo a mejorado su condición de vida. La cual se vieron en la necesidad de solicitar el préstamo para la continuidad y ampliación de sus negocios.
texts.en:
This group of people live in the town of San José el Ídolo, and are asking for a loan from the ASDIR Association because they work in the center and the surrounding villages of this town. They sell clothing, food and various items as street vendors and want the loan to be able to continue selling their products in different communities to widen their customer base. These people have been able to get ahead through these sales, and now can give their children basic primary education. In the past they could only count on their husbands’ earnings to cover household expenses, but now with their businesses and their profits that have been increasing through the sales, the group has been able to improve their living conditions. This can be confirmed with their need to ask for the loan to continue and expand their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand their merchandise of clothing and various products and their business of selling food and tortillas that they sell in the town of San Jose and its surrounding villages.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos menores de edad en el sector Tres Puentes, una zona rural del distrito de Pítipo, situado a una hora y cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace aun año tiene instalada en su vivienda una bodega en la que ofrece a sus vecinos todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio nació de la necesidad de obtener un ingreso adicional que les permitiera a ella ya a su familia salir adelante, ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como peón agrícola no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares.

El establecimiento goza de buena acogida ya que la zona se encuentra retirada del mercado mas cercano y sus vecinos no pueden movilizarse todos los dias para adquirir productos de consumo diario. Teresa trata de brindarles productos de calidad y un buen trato para que el negocio crezca y se desarrolle favorablemente. 

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de abarrotes para aumentar sus ventas y captar mas ingresos, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Teresa es una mujer alegre que disfruta mucho de su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar alguna carrera superior que les depare un futuro prometedor. Esta es la segunda vez que ella trabaja con Nuestra Institucion y ha demsotrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Teresa is 45 years old and lives with her husband and her three dependent children in the Tres Puentes area, a rural area in the district of Pítipo, located an hour and forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. A year ago, Teresa set up a small store in her home, where she offers her neighbors all sorts of basic products and groceries. She started this business because she needed the extra income in order for her family to stay afloat, because her husband's income as a farmhand was not enough to cover the household expenses. Her shop enjoys a good business because the area where she lives is far from the closest market and her neighbors can't travel there every day to get the basic goods they need. Teresa tries to offer them high-quality products and good service so that her business will grow and develop well. Teresa would like to expand her store by buying more groceries, which would increase her sales and bring in more income. For this reason she is asking Edpyme Alternativa [the Kiva field partner] for a loan of 1200 Peruvian Soles to help her reach her goal. Teresa is a happy woman who very much enjoys her work. Her greatest desire is to give her children the opportunity to study towards an advanced degree that will offer them a better future. This is the second time that she has worked with the field partner and she has shown herself to be responsible and on time with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries to expand her store.

loans.name: Sulari

texts.en:
Sulari is a 41-year-old woman who is married with three children living in Dickwella in the southern part of Sri Lanka.  Her husband is a driver and she has a small tailoring business that she runs independently.  At the moment, Sulari is running the business from her house and receives help from her eldest son.  She started this business with her first loan from BRAC. This will be her second loan, helping her to expand.  She is a very active and strong lady, which helps her with her customers.  

Sulari is seeking a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC, her second with this MFI.  In the future, she hopes to eventually open up her own shop, so she does not have to perform her tailoring services from her house.  

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Teresa Magnolia

texts.es:
Teresa M. de 51 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es comerciante ellos tienen dos hijos.  

El esposo de Teresa vendía artículos varios en la Había de Guayaquil (Lugar donde se reúnen todos los comerciantes informales a vender mercadería), Teresa tenia la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio y decidió invertir sus ahorros en una silla y artículos de un gabinete. 

En la actualidad ella tiene 10 años con su salón de belleza y su esposo ahora tiene el local de artículos en su casa.  trabaja desde muy temprano haciendo cortes de cabello, peinados, alisados, etc. Ahora ha implementado dar a crédito los tratamientos para cabello a sus clientes fieles en al tarde sale a recorrer su sector para ofrecerlos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar sillas, tintes, productos de belleza para su negocio. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y que sus hijos terminen con éxito sus estudios.
texts.en:
Teresa M., 51, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil; her house is cement and has all basic utilities. Her husband is a merchant and they have two children. Teresa’s husband sold assorted merchandise in Guayaquil’s La Había (a place where informal merchants gather to sell their wares). Teresa was desperate to have her own business so she invested all her savings in a salon chair and the equipment for a beauty salon work station. She has now had her beauty salon for 10 years and her husband has his store in their home. She works from very early in the day doing haircuts, hairdos, hair straightening, etc. She has now added providing hair treatment services on credit to her best customers. She goes out in the afternoons to offer these services in her area. She will use the funds to buy salon chairs, dyes and beauty products for her business. She would like to enlarge her business in the future and that her children complete their education successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chairs, dyes, ampules (hair treatment)

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Née en 1979 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, G. Alice vit depuis 15 ans à PK10, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Alice est mariée à PADONOU Léonard, un chauffeur, et est mère de trois enfants. Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. Alice vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Alice n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Alice vend depuis 12 ans environs, des condiments de sauce (tomates fraîches, oignons, piments, etc.), des poissons frits, ainsi que du charbon de bois à son domicile. Alice s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Alice a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué le remboursement. Dans l'optique d'augmenter son stock de produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Alice sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Alice G. was born in 1979 at Porto Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, For the last 15 years she has lived at PK 10 in the commune of Seme-Podji. She lives with her husband Leonard Padonou, who is a driver, and their three children, not all of whom have been to school. She and her share household expenses. She herself has not been to school. To meet her needs, for about 12 years she has sold ingredients for sauces (tomatoes, onions, peppers and so forth), and also fried fish and charcoal, from her home. She buys her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has had one previous loan from ALIDe, which she repaid in timely manner. With a view to boosting her inventory and better serving her customers, she is asking for a second loan from ALIDe.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sauce ingredients and fish.

loans.name: Grupo Chuiquisis Group

texts.es: El grupo Chuiquisis an enprendido un negocio, formadas por mujeres  trabajadoras  han tenido a bien  realizar  en la compra y venta D. textiles y ropa tipica donD. comercializan  en otros lugares  D. la republica D. Guatemala y por la falta D. Capital D. trabajo  acuden a la ASOCIACIÒN ASDIR para este apoyo, consideran ellas que con este incremento les ayudaran en conjunto  a obtener màs ganancia y asi superar màs en el negocio y poder ayudar a su familia y especialmente a sus hijos para sacarlo avante en la edad escolar y tener otro nivel D. vida, por ello piden esta ayuda.
texts.en:
The group Chuiquisis, formed by hardworking women, has launched a business buying and selling textiles and traditional clothing. They market their products in other places in the Republic of Guatemala. As they lack working capital they have come to the ASOCIACIÒN ASDIR looking for support. They think that this loan will help them to increase their joint earnings and help their business to succeed so that they can help their families. They particularly want to help their children to advance in their studies so that they can have a higher living standard, and to do this they are asking for this assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for clothing and textile business

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla M., tiene un negocio que consiste en elaborar trajes de manta, cotonas y Blusas caladas estas las oferta en el Mercado de Artesanía de Masaya, en el Mercado de Granada y otros clientes que viajan al extranjero, ella es madre de 3 hijos quienes se encuentran en edad escolar, la señora con este negocio le provee de todos sus gastos a su familia, esta solicitando un crédito con CEPRODEL, para la compra de Dacron de 60 pulg., manta indú e insumos y con esto  poder suplir la demanda que le exige sus clientes y así tener las posibilidades económicas de brindarle una buena condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Karla M. has a business making dresses, jackets, and dyed blouses made of cotton. She sells her products at the Craft Market of Masaya, the Granada Market, and to customers who travel abroad. Karla is the mother of three school aged children. As a result of her business, she is able to provide for all of the family expenses.

Karla is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to buy five feet of Dacron, Indian cotton, and supplies so that she can meet the demand of her customers and have economic possibilities of providing her children with good living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Dacron, cotton, and other supplies

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Georgette est mariée à SOSSOU Philippe, un chauffeur. Le couple a trois enfants à leurs charges, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Il y a près de 12 ans que Georgette s'est installée au quartier Fiégnon à Cotonou, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Georgette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis douze ans, Georgette vend des condiments de sauce (tomates fraîches, oignons, piments, huile, etc.) à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Georgette  s'approvisionne dans le même marché. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu auparavant trois crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Georgette ambitionne renforcer son activité en l'agrandissant et en la diversifiant, afin de mieux faire face à la demande des clients et se faire plus de revenu. C'est pour y parvenir que Georgette sollicite un quatrième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Georgette A. is married to SOSSOU Philippe, a driver. The couple has three children to care for, of whom two are their own. Some 12 years ago, Georgette settled with her children and her husband in the Fiégnon borough of Cotonou. The couple jointly shares the various family expenses. Georgette has not attended school. For the past 12 years she has sold sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, oil, etc.) in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. She gets her supplies from the same market. Georgette is a regular client of ALIDé, having already been granted three previous loans, all reimbursed in full. She wishes to strengthen her activity by increasing and diversifying it, to better meet customer demand and generate more income. To reach that goal she is now requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sauce condiments (tomatoes, hot peppers, onions, etc.)

loans.name: Inés

texts.es: La señora O. tiene una pulpería ubicada en la comarca Los Altos jurisdicción de Masaya,  ella ofrece diferentes tipos de productos, es madre soltera y a cargo tiene un hijo el cual es el que le ayuda en el negocio después que viene de clases. Ella está visitando las Oficinas de CEPRODEL para que le den un financiamiento para la compra de arroz Faizán, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, gaseosas, arroz Doña María y detergentes;  y de esta forma surtiendo más su negocio tener un poco más de ganancia y darle una vida digna y cómoda a su hijo.
texts.en:
La señora O. has a small grocery store in the Los Altos region, Mayasa jurisdiction. She sells a variety of products. She is a single mother, and her son helps her in the store after school. She is visiting the office of CEPRODEL (local lending institution) to obtain a loan for the purchase of Faizán rice, sugar, oil, beans, soft drinks, Doña María rice, and detergents. These purchases will replenish her inventory, boost her earnings a little, and give a decent, comfortable life to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Faizán rice, sugar, oil, beans, soft drinks, Doña María rice, and detergents

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “EL PROGRESO”

La alcancía comunal “EL PROGRESO” es un grupo autodenominado así porque sus miembros buscan sobresalir en lo que hacen y no quedarse atrás, es un grupo que ya lleva trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD 3 años con 2 meses y es partícipe D. las actividades, charlas y capacitaciones que esta ofrece.

Cinty es presidenta del grupo “EL PROGRESO”, tiene una hija y vive con su pareja, ella se caracteriza por ser una presidenta muy joven, pues tiene 24 años D. edad, elegida por las demás socias por ser activa y tener mucho entusiasmo.

Ella se dedica a ser vendedora empleada en una mueblería, tiene varios meses trabajando en la venta D. muebles, y quiere poner su propio negocio D. venta D. muebles. Piensa usar su crédtio para comprar sillas, bancas, etc. para ya dedicarse a la venta directa para no estar trabajando en la mueblería sino D. forma independiente. Planea ahorrar para así estudiar “Visitadora médica”, pero por ahora los gastos que tiene en su casa superan sus ingresos, aunque también aporte su pareja.

Por ahora el mayor sueño D. Cinty es tener una casa propia así dejaría D. pagar un alquiler mensual.
texts.en:
The El Progreso Community Bank members chose this name because they are looking to get ahead in their jobs and not remain stuck in the past. The group has already worked with Kiva partner EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for 3 years and 2 months and has participated in the activities, talks, and training that have been offered. Cinty is the president of the the El Progreso group. She has one daughter and lives with her partner. She seems a very young president, but she is 24 years old and was chosen by the other members because she is active and has a lot of enthusiasm. Cinty is a salesperson in a furniture shop. She's been doing this work for several months, and wants to open her own business selling furniture. She plans to use the loan to buy chairs and benches so that she can sell directly and independently to clients instead of working at the furniture shop. She is planning to save enough money to go back to school and become a distributor of medications (to local clinics). However, her current household expenses are more than her income even though her partner contributes too. For the time being Cindy's goal is to have a house of her own so she wouldn't have to pay rent.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chairs and benches to open a furniture sales business

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras De San Jose El Idolo Group

texts.es:
Este  grupo  de personas residen en el Barrio San Francisco del municipio de San José El Ídolo Suchitepéquez,
y  solicitaron  un  crédito en la  Asociación  ASDIR, debido a que estas personas comercializan en el 
centro  de  dicho Municipio  y  áreas circunvecinos, estas  personas venden lo que es ropa,  frutas, venta de
tortillas, Refacciones y crianza de marranos son de tipo ambulante y que se vieron en la necesidad de solicitar
un crédito para poder mantener la venta  así darle continuidad.  Se ha notado en  ellas la buena intención
de  superación ya que actualmente viven en un nivel económico muy bajo y necesitan el capital porque a través
de ello puedan incrementar la venta   y llegar a logros muy importantes como el mejorar la Educación y 
la Salud de sus hijos, y así poder contribuir, ya que actualmente solo cuentan con los ingresos de sus esposos
el cual no es suficiente  para los gastos del hogar,   por  esa razón   necesitan el crédito y así mejorar 
su condición de vida.  hay dos personas insertas en la fotografia que solicitaron su credito pero la cual no fueron calificadas segun el criterio de la Asociacion Asdir.
texts.en:
This group of people lives in the San Francisco neighborhood of San José El Ídolo Suchitepéquez. They are requesting funds from Asociación ASDIR because they are merchants in the downtown area of said municipality and adjoining areas. They sell: clothing, fruit, tortillas, spare parts; some raise pigs. They sell their products moving from place to place and need funds to be able to continue their work. It has been noted that they wish to improve because they currently live in a very low socio-economic stratum and need capital through with they can increase sales and reach important goals such as improving the education and health of their children thereby contributing since they currently have only their husbands’ earnings and these are insufficient to meet household needs. For this reason they need the loan in order to improve their living conditions. There are two persons that appear in the photo who did not qualify for a loan according to Asociación ASDIR’s qualifying criteria.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for clothing, fruit and tortilla sales as well as for raising animals.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
El Señor José Alfredo H. S., es comerciante del mercado central tiene un negocio de venta de granos básicos en el callejon de la distribuidora de el Masaya, anteriormente el Señor H. S. trabajaba como contador en una empresa y su esposa era la que administraba el negocio pero su señora falleció y luego el quedo administrando su negocio.
Tiene once años de dedicarse a esta actividad, se esfuerza bastante para salir adelante abre su negocio de lunes y domingo de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
Sus financiamientos los solicita para surtir su negocio comprando la mercadería que poca existencia tiene en ese momento. Tiene cuatro años  de trabajar con ceprodel en los cuales dice que estos financiamientos le han ayudado a salir adelante a surtir su negocio poco a poco.
texts.en:
Señor José Alfredo H. S. is a merchant in the central market. He has a business selling basic grains in the alley by Masaya Distrubutors. Señor H. S. used to work as an accountant in a firm and his wife managed his business, but his wife died and he ended up taking care of the business. He has been doing this for eleven years and tries hard to get ahead. He opens his business Mondays through Sundays from 7:00 a.m to 4:00 p.m. He's asking for a loan to stock his business by buying merchandise that is hard to come by at this time. He has been working with Cedropel for four years and says that these loans have helped him to get ahead and stock his business bit by bit.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for my business, basic grains.

loans.name: Elena Elisa

texts.es:
Elena P. de 27 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es madre soltera ella tiene 3 hijos. 

Elena inicio vendiendo  ropa por catalogo y haciendo trabajos de gabinete. En la actualidad sale desde muy temprano ha ofrecer sus servicios de estilista, va personalmente ha la casa del cliente a hacer pedicure, manicure, cortes de cabello, etc. Aunque otro ingreso que tiene es un pequeño puesto de ropa, sigue buscando más oportunidades de crecer en sus negocios para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos. 

Una de las dificultades que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector por donde vive, pero con el préstamo quiere construir mejor su casa para más seguridad.

En el futuro quiere poder construir mejor su casa y incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elena P., 27, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil; her house is cement and has all basic utilities. She is a single mother of three children. Elena started out selling catalogue clothing and doing beauty salon work. Currently, she goes out very early in the morning to offer her services as a stylist. She goes personally to the customer’s home to do pedicures, manicures, haircuts, etc. Even though she has another source of income, a small clothing sales stall, she continues to seek other opportunities for growth in her businesses in order to insure a better future for her children. One of the difficulties she faces is the high crime rate in her area; she wants to use the funds requested to build her house more securely. In the future, she would like to make her house more secure and increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Manuel de Jesus T., tiene 61 años, casado y su esposa es ama de casa, tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad, que viven de forma independientes y de estado civil casado, el menor de los hermanos le apoya a su padre en la tareas del hogar.

Dentro de las necesidades primordiales que tiene la familia esta la remodelacion de su hogar, y las limitaciones economicas han impedido que se lleve a cabo dicho proyecto es por eso que solicitan de un prestamo para la compra de materilaes de construción y terminar de construir su vivienda. Ellos invertirian el credito en la compra de materiales de construccion, brindandole a futuro tras la culminacion de esto, la tranquilidad necesaria para vivir sus dias en un ambiente mas comodo, seguro y cons mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesus T. is 61 years old and married. His wife is a homemaker. They have four older children who are married and independent. The youngest helps his father with household chores. Among the basic needs of the family is the remodeling of their home. Financial impediments have prevented them from carrying out this project. For this reason they are seeking a loan, the proceeds of which will go toward the purchase of construction materials needed to finish the house. Realizing this goal will afford them the tranquility of living in a comfortable environment, secure and with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora  Reyna Isabel G. M., es comerciante de este mercado su tramo esta ubicado de la esquina de almacén mundo elegante  75 vrs al norte la señora vende jabones, aces, cloros, sal  tiene 20 años de vender en este mercado.
Su negocio lo inicio con poca mercadería con un capital de C$ 2,0000 fueron aporte de su hijo, tiene tres hijos que mantener por los cuales ella se esfuerza grandemente para sacarlos adelante  abre su negocio  a las siete y media de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde de lunes a domingo.
La Señora G. M. tiene 3 años de trabajar con ceprodel ella se siente muy agradecida de estar trabajando con nosotros ya que ha salido adelante con su negocio
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel G. M. is a merchant in this market. Her stand is located 75 varas (a vara is approximately .8 meter) north of the corner of Almacén Mundo Elegante. She sells soaps, detergents, bleach, and salt. She has been selling in this market for 20 years. She started her business with C$ 2,0000 from her son, and she had little merchandise. She has three children to support, and she puts forth great effort to get them ahead. She opens her business at 7:30 in the morning, and she is open until 4:00 in the afternoon from Monday through Sunday. Mrs. G. M. has worked with Ceprodel for three years. She is very grateful to be working with us because she has gotten ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soaps, detergents, bleaches, and salt; which is what she sells

loans.name: Mauro Juvenal

texts.es:
Mauro, tiene 73 años y tiene tres hijos de las cuales todos ya son independientes, él es un padre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyar a sus hijos.

Mauro es docente jubilado y trabajó 33 años para el colegio particular “Integrando de Urubamba”. Actualmente, él socio tiene un pequeño negocio que es un café restaurante que esta ubicado en su domicilio, en el restaurante se prepara desayuno y almuerzo para personas que están pensionadas. 

Mauro pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son 15 años que funciona el banco comunal. Su primer crédito del socio fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente el socio requiere el préstamo para implementar el restaurante y para pagar las  matriculas de sus nietos.                 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mauro is 73 years old, and he has three children who are all independent. He is a responsible father who looks every minute for opportunities to get ahead. He looks to use his daily effort to help his children. Mario is a retired teacher. He worked for 33 years at Integrando de Urubamba, a private school. He currently has a small business, which is a café type restaurant. It is located in his house. He prepares breakfast and lunch for retired people. Mauro belongs to the Tercer Milenio Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa. The bank has been in existence for 15 years. His first loan was for 100 dollars, which he invested in his business. He currently needs a loan to equip the restaurant and to pay his grandchildren’s school enrollment fees. He is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and he promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip his restaurant and to pay his grandchildren's school enrollment fees

loans.name: Brenda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Brenda del Socorro G. M., tiene un negocio de venta de frutas ubicados a cuatro cuadras aledañas del mercado central en la esquina de la Ferretería Navarro ahí la señora G. M. tiene 10 años de estar operando en ese lugar su negocio empezo con  un capital de C$ 1,000.00, capital que fue una ayuda para ella de parte de su mamá.
La Señora Brenda G. vende frutas peladas en bolsas bananos, sandias, naranjas etc, de los cuales necesita los financiamientos para surtir su negocio.
Siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante tiene una niña de  que es la razón por la cual se esfuerza cada día mas trabaja de lunes a domingos de 8 de la mañana  a cuatro de la tarde sin descansar un día a su niña se la trae al tramo junto con ella por que no tiene quien se la cuide lleva  dos años de trabajar con Ceprodel y siente que la hemos ayudado bastante por que al suave ha venido comprando sus  cositas que son útiles para ella en su casa además
texts.en:
Sra. Brenda del Socorro G. M. has a business selling fruit in the four blocks surrounding the central market. Her stand is located on the corner near the Navarro Hardware Store.

Sra. G. has ten years of experience running her business at this location. She started with capital worth 1000 NIO, which was assistance she received from her mother. Brenda sells bags of bananas, watermelons, oranges, and other fruits. She needs financing in order to restock her business.

Brenda has always strived to get ahead. She has a daughter who is the reason why she works hard every day. Brenda looks after her stand Monday through Sunday from 8am until 4pm without taking a day of rest. She brings her daughter with her because she does not have anyone to take care of her.

Brenda has been working with CEPRODEL for two years. She feels the assistance she has received has gone smoothly in helping her buy things that are useful to her and for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & bags for her business

loans.name: Brenda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Brenda del Socorro G. M., tiene un negocio de venta de frutas ubicados a cuatro cuadras aledañas del mercado central en la esquina de la Ferretería Navarro ahí la señora G. M. tiene 10 años de estar operando en ese lugar su negocio empezo con  un capital de C$ 1,000.00, capital que fue una ayuda para ella de parte de su mamá.
La Señora Brenda G. vende frutas peladas en bolsas bananos, sandias, naranjas etc, de los cuales necesita los financiamientos para surtir su negocio.
Siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante tiene una niña de  que es la razón por la cual se esfuerza cada día mas trabaja de lunes a domingos de 8 de la mañana  a cuatro de la tarde sin descansar un día a su niña se la trae al tramo junto con ella por que no tiene quien se la cuide lleva  dos años de trabajar con Ceprodel y siente que la hemos ayudado bastante por que al suave ha venido comprando sus  cositas que son útiles para ella en su casa además
texts.en:
Sra. Brenda del Socorro G. M. has a business selling fruits in the four blocks surrounding the central market. Her stand is located on the corner near the Navarro Hardware Store.

Sra. G. has ten years of experience running her business at this location. She started with capital worth 1000 NIO, which was assistance she received from her mother. Brenda sells bags of bananas, watermelons, oranges, and other fruits. She needs financing in order to restock her business.

Brenda has always strived to get ahead. She has a daughter who is the reason why she works hard every day. Brenda looks after her stand Monday through Sunday from 8am until 4pm without taking a day of rest. She brings her daughter with her because she does not have anyone to take care of her.

Brenda has been working with CEPRODEL for two years. She feels the assistance she has received has gone smoothly in helping her buy things that are useful to her and for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & bags for her business

loans.name: Petronila Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Señora R. B., trabaja comprando diferentes tipos de artesanía, los puntos de ventas prácticamente son los mercados, ella se acerca a CEPRODEL para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de hamacas unipersonal, chino de manila y jarrones ya que esto es lo que le están demandando más ahorita en está temporada, ella no tiene ningún hijo a cargo, con la ganancia que obtiene se mantiene todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
R. B. buys different types of handicrafts, and she sells them at the markets. She has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy single hammocks, hammock chairs made from thick yarn, and vases. Those items are most in demand during this season. She does not have a child under her care. She will use the earnings she receives to pay all of her expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy single hammocks, hammock chairs made from thick yarn, and vases

loans.name: Rosa Janet

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene a su cargo dos niños con necesidades especiales. Viven en el sector Tambo Real, una zona rural del distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, situado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas junto a su esposo desde hace ya varios años. Ella tiene una hectárea de terreno heredada de su padre en donde siembran granos y verduras para venderlas y hacerse de ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos familiares, adicionalmente ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (aves y cerdos) con la cual se generan un ingreso extra.

Actualmente Rosa y su esposo han sembrado maíz en su terreno, el cultivo esta en buenas condiciones y ellos necesitan brindarle mantenimiento, por este motivo se han visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensan utilizar en la compra de abonos y foliares para mejorar la calidad de su cultivo.

Rosa es una mujer bantante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder hacer mejoras en la vivienda en la que vive ya que esta construida de material rustico.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old, is married and has two children with special needs. They live in Tambor Real, a rural zone in the Pitipo district, Ferreñafe Province, located an hour away from Chiclayo city. Rosa has worked in agriculture with her husband for several years. She has a hectare of land, inherited from her father, on which she sows grains and vegetables to sell so she can cover the family's expenses. She also raises and sells farmyard animals (birds and pigs) for extra income. Currently Rosa and her husband have sown corn on their land. The crop is doing well, and they need to maintain it. This is why they had to ask Edpyme Alternativa for their first loan of 1000 new soles, with which they want to purchase supplies and foliar fertilizers to improve crop quality. Rosa is very hard-working and dedicated to her family. Her greatest desire is to be able to improve their house since it is built of rustic materials.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and foliar fertilizers for maintenance of corn crop

loans.name: Perlas De Cristo Group

texts.es:
Este  grupo  D. personas residen en el Sector Las Cruces del municipio D. Santo Domingo Suchitepéquez, y  solicitaron  un  crédito en la  Asociación  ASDIR, debido a que estas personas comercializan en el 
centro  D.  dicho Municipio  y  áreas circunvecinos, estas  personas venden lo que es pollos,  frutas, cultivo
D. maiz, crianza D. marranos, servicio D. barbería son D. tipo ambulante y que se vieron en la necesidad D.  
solicitar un crédito para poder mantener la venta, el cultivo y el servicio así darle continuidad a sus diferentes actividades productivas.  Se ha notado en  ellas la buena intención D.  superación ya que actualmente viven en un nivel muy bajo económicamente y necesitan el capital porque a través D. ello puedan incrementar la 
venta   y llegar a logros muy importantes como el mejorar la Educación y la Salud D. sus hijos, y así poder
satisfacer estas necesidades que son muy importantes para el desarrollo tanto D. la persona como la D. 
su familia. Cabe recalcar que en este grupo D. mujeres hay dos personas que solicitaron su credito y estan insertas en la fotografia que ya no se les otorgará el credito por criterios muy objetivos D. la Asociacion Asdir.
texts.en:
This group of people lives in the Las Cruces Sector of the city of Santo Domingo Suchitepéquez. They requested this loan through the ASDIR Association, as all of the group’s members do business in the city center and surrounding areas. These people sell chickens, fruits, and corn, pork, and even cut hair, all on foot. They saw the need to request this loan in order to be able to maintain sales, harvests, and services and give continuity to their productive activities. Their desire to improve their livers is very evident, since they presently live in a low economic state and need working capital so that they can increase their sales and make important accomplishments, such as providing for the education and health of their children, which is important for their families’ development. Two of the ladies shown in the photograph who will not be receiving money from this loan, based on objective criteria from ASDIR.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Thelma

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Thelma S. tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos en el mercado central ubicado del almacén mundo elegante 10 vrs al norte 5 vrs al oeste vende todo lo que es cosméticos, perfumes, colonias, talcos, cremas, shampoo, rinse, etc.
 Este financiamiento la Señora S. lo solicito para abastecer su negocio comprando mercadería de los catálogos de la avón y zermat que tambien vende de esos productos en su tramo.
Su negocio lo empezo hace treinta años con apoyo de su esposo que fue el que le brindo la ayuda del capital para empezar su negocio, anteriormente vendía cosméticos ambulante y ama de casa a la vez pero se aburrió de andar buscando clientelas decidio tener un tramo en el mercado es una mujer dedicada a su negocio, y a sus nietas tuvo 4 hijos pero ninguno dependen de ella mas que solos dos nieta que estan a su cargo y es por las que se esfuerza día a día para salir adelante junto con ellas, lleva cinco años de trabajar con nuestra institución y se siente muy apoyada por nosotros ya que su negocio ha incrementado gracia a estos financiamientos obtenidos con nosotros.
texts.en:
María Thelma S. sells Cosmetics in the central market which is located 10 varas (an obsolete unit of length = 0.8359 m in SI units) north and 5 varas west of the Mundo Elegante store; she sells all sorts of cosmetics: perfumes, colognes, talc, creams, shampoos, rinses, etc. She will use the funds to stock her business with items from the Avon and Zermat catalogues because she also sells these brands of cosmetics in her stand. She started her business 30 years ago with support from her husband who provided her with her start-up capital. She used to sell door-to-door to housewives but she became bored with the process of looking for customers so she decided to have her own stall in the market. She is very dedicated to her business and to her granddaughters. She had four children but none of them depend on her any longer; however, she does support and care for two granddaughters and it is for them that she works every day to get ahead with them. She has collaborated with our institution for five years and she feels much supported by us since her business has grown thanks to financing obtained from us.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mbithe

texts.en: Mbithe is 28 years old and married with two children who go to school. She sells charcoal to her neighbors. She has been in this business for two years. She also keeps animals for commercial purposes to earn enough money to provide for her family and pay school fees for her children. She had previously taken out a loan from Faulu Kenya, which she used to expand her business, and she successfully repaid it. She hopes to grow her business and start her own school in the future. She has requested for a loan to add more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: To add stock of charcoal

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina,  tiene 49 años y tiene cinco hijos D. las cuales todos son independientes,  ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyar a sus hijos.

Josefina alterna sus actividades del hogar con su negocio D. venta D. chicha D. quinua D. forma ambulatoria. Ya son 20 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella venD. el vaso D. chicha a 50 céntimos y por día venD. tres baldes D. chicha y gana aproximadamente 60 soles. 

Josefina pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” D. la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son 15 años que funciona el banco comunal y ella participa. Su primer crédito D. la socia fue D. 100 dólares D. las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente,  la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo quinua, azúcar y leña. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Josefina is 49 years old and has five adult children, all independent. She is a responsible mother who constantly searches for opportunities to advance and give support to her children. She alternates her household responsibilities with those of her business, selling “chicha” on foot. (Chicha is a fermented drink.) She has been doing this for 20 years and it has been going very well, thanks to the effort she puts into it. She sells each glass of chicha for 50 céntimos and sells a total of three buckets per day, earning approximately 60 PEN. Josefina is a member of the “TERCER MILENIO” (Third Millennium) communal bank of the Arariwa Association. The bank has been operating for 15 years. Her first loan was for $100, which she used to invest into her business. Now she is needs a loan to buy supplies, such as quinine, sugar, and firewood. She is grateful for the opportunity she has been given and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplires

loans.name: Cruz Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Cruz Antonio T. G., es trabajador de la Empresa Lotería Nacional de Chinandega de la cual tenemos un convenio con dicha empresa tiene de laborar para esa institución 10 años como vigilante.
Es casado son cuatro en su familia el, su esposa y dos hijos de los cuales los tres dependen de él es un hombre trabajador y luchador trabaja de 24 horas descansando las 24 horas seguidas pero él en tiempos libre vende raspaditas.
El financiamiento lo solicita para realizarle alguna mejora a su hogar o para cubrir gastos personales se siente muy agradecido con estos financiamientos que le han brindado gracias al convenio que adquirió su empresa donde trabaja con ceprodel
texts.en:
Sr. Cruz Antonio T. G. is an employee of the National Lottery Enterprise in Chinandega, with which CEPRODEL has a business contract. He has been working for this institution as a security guard for ten years.

He is married and lives with his wife and two children who are dependent on him. Cruz struggles and works for 24 hours straight and then rests for 24 hours. In his free time, he sells lottery scratch-off tickets.

The loan he is requesting will be used to make some improvements to his home and also cover personal expenses. He is very grateful for these loans which have been provided as a result of an agreement between CEPRODEL and his employer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make a few improvements to his home & pay some personal expenses

loans.name: Mwatu

texts.en: Mwatu is 36 years old and married with two children who go to school. He has been running a retail shop where he sells general merchandise such as cooking fat, sugar, soaps, maize flour, rice, plastic containers and energy-saving jikos. He has been involved in this business for three years and has two employees. He rears animals together with his wife to improve their living standards. He hopes to grow his business and also add more cattle in the future. He has requested for a loan from Faulu Kenya to add stock of maize flour and rice.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and rice

loans.name: Katanda Tukwatanise Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
H. Evasi, appearing at the top left in the small photo, also appears in the big group photo as the group leader. She is a hardworking and determined lady aged 32 years and married with five children aged 11, 10, 8, 6 and 4 years, all of them in school.

For four years now, Evasi has sold produce from Katerera trading centre and this includes beans, maize, peas, groundnuts (peanuts) and so on. Although her business profits keep on fluctuating because of the seasonal changes affecting the agricultural sector, she is able to make 150,000/= as monthly profits on average. She attributes her success and business continuity to her good customer care and to the loans.

Evasi would like to expand her business to wholesale as well as educate all her children to university level. She needs a loan to help with buying more produce to sell at a profit and this will increase her business stock and general turnover.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize, peas, groundnuts and so on

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a wife of H. A. and lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. Her husband has a sweetmeat shop in the main market. He has a long list of customers because he has maintained the quality of his shop over the seven years he has been in business. His earnings help him to improve his family's standard of living. 
Khalida is also a very hardworking lady. She sells different kinds of books in her bookshop. Her collection is centered on syllabus books, religious books and comic stories, which are all in high demand. She has been running this business for the past two years. Her income helps her to meet financial expenses with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy items, such as cooking oil, sugar and dry fruits, to expand her husband’s sweetmeat shop.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her husband's sweetmeat business

loans.name: Antonia Juárez

texts.es:
La Señora Antonia Juárez E. tiene un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras ubicado en el mercado central de la iglesia el calvario1c al oeste  75 vrs al norte, tiene de vender 30 años  empezo con un capital de C$2,000.00 aporte de su esposo  en esos treinta años que tiene de vender le ha dado gracias a Dios por que saco adelante a sus hijas con sus estudios en la actualidad solo tiene una a su cargo.
Su hija le viene a ayudar a vender a su puesto madrugan de lunes a domingo venden desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a sembrar en su finca y vendía ambulante  pero decidio vender en el mercado frutas y verdura, La señora Antonia Juárez ya fue clienta de nosotros tiempo atrás en el 2005-2006 y ahora decidio seguir trabajando con nosotros ya que nesecitaba una mano amiga  ya que le gustaba la forma de trabajar del banco y pues nunca quedo mal entonces las puertas estaban abiertas para ella, y que  los créditos son rápidos y espera seguir trabajando por más tiempo con nosotros.
texts.en:
Sra. Antonia Juárez E. has a vegetable and fruit stand located at the central market, which is one block to the west and 75 “varas” (63 meters) north of the Calvary Church. She has been selling for 30 years and started with capital of 2000 NIO that was contributed by her husband. In those 30 years of making sales, she gives thanks to God that her daughters were able to get ahead in their studies. At the moment, she only has one daughter who is still a dependent.

Sra. Antonia previous grew crops on her farm and sold her produce as a street vendor, but later decided to sell fruits and vegetables at the market. She was a client of ours a long time ago during the period of 2005-2006. Antonia has now decided to continue working with us because she needs a helping hand. She has always liked the way the bank works and has never had any bad experiences. The doors have been open for her. Her loans were approved quickly and she hopes to continue working further with us.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 48 years old and single with three children who go to school. She has been running a green grocery for five years. She also rears dairy cattle and sells milk. With the business, she is able to meet her family’s expenses and pay school fees for her children. Since she became a member of Faulu Kenya, her living conditions hves improved because she can access loans to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business and open outlets in the future. She has requested for a loan from Faulu Kenya to buy maize and beans for sale.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Silvia Elena M. A. es comerciante del Mercado Central desde hace cuatro años tiene un puesto de venta de ropa. Es casada tiene tres hijos dos de ellos en edad escolar cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, su negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 3,000.00 aporte de su esposo  con poco inventario ahora su negocio esta surtido antes ella era ama de casa pero con la situación en la que hemos venido atravesando decidio poner su propio negocio y depender de ella  no solo de su esposo ya que son tres niños los que hay que mantener.
La Señora M. A. tiene 1 año de trabajar con ceprodel en los cuales los financiamientos obtenidos por nosotros le han servido de mucho ya que su inventario ha incrementado ha podido sacar adelante a sus niños se esfuerza por ellos y para ellos trabaja diario si no habre el negocio busca como colocar la mercadería en otros tramos dejándola al crédito y cobrando diario.
texts.en:
Silvia Elena M. A. has been a merchant in the central market for four years. She has a stall where she sells clothes. She is married, and she has three children. Two of the children are school age. She has her husband’s support. She started her business with C$3,000.00 from her husband, and she had little inventory. Now her business is stocked. Previously she was a housewife. But, due to the situation they have been going through, she decided to set up her own business. That way they can depend upon her, not just her husband. There are three children to support. Mrs. M. A. has been working with Ceprodel for one year. During that time the loans from us have helped her a lot. She has increased her inventory, and she has been able to get her children ahead. Her efforts are for them. She works for them everyday. If the business does not open, she looks to place her merchandise in other retails spaces. She leaves it on credit, and collects daily.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres "la Esperanza" Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de personas residen en Aldea Margarita del Rosario, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez, y solicitaron 
un crédito en la Asociación ASDIR, debido a que deseaban empezar una venta en la aldea. Actualmente 
cada una de estas personas ya cuenta con una venta, las cuales son, venta de pollos, venta de almuerzos 
refacciones, venta de verduras y servicios de costurería. A través del tiempo se ha visto la superación que 
estas personas han tenido esto gracias a el buen manejo del capital  que tienen actualmente, ya que ahora
no solo cuentan con el apoyo económico de sus esposos sino que también ellas aportan a la economía del 
hogar por lo que ha contribuido al mejoramiento económico de sus familias.
texts.en:
This group of women resides in the village of Margarita del Rosario, in San Antonio, Suchitepéquez. They requested a loan from the organization ASDIR because they wanted to start businesses in the village. Currently, all of them already have their own businesses, such as selling chickens, lunches, vegetables, and providing catering and seamstress services. In time, they have made noticeable progress thanks to the good management of their current capital; now, they not only have the economic support of their husbands, but they are able to contribute themselves to the household finances and improve the economic situation of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as chickens, lunches, vegetables, and other products

loans.name: Ana Ethel

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, específicamente en el mercado Central, la señora Ana Jarquín tiene su propio tramo de venta de ropa el cuál lo inició desde hace cinco años y hoy en día lo ha ido mejorando gracias a su gran esfuerzo y dedicación en el negocio.

Es madre de un pequeño hijo en edad escolar al que debe de sustentar y brindarle todas las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle. La razón por la que está solicitando el crédito es para invertir en la compra de la ropa para proceder a su respectiva comercialización en su localidad y de esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes que le buscan para adquirir la ropa que ella vende.
texts.en:
Ana Ethel J. S. has a store in her house. It is located two blocks to the west of the Edén Club in the Guadalupe neighborhood. She sells clothes, footwear, and toys. She started her business five years ago with C$ 10,000.00 from her parents. Before that she was a student. She opens her business at eight in the morning, and it is open until six in the evening from Monday to Sunday. Mrs. J. S. is a tenacious young woman. She makes sacrifices to get her school age child ahead. She has used her loans to stock her store by purchasing merchandise. She says that she is very grateful to Ceprodel because they have helped get her business ahead. Also, her family has been helped by being able to purchase necessary items for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and footwear for children and adults to stock her business
